Quote: We can easily forgive a child who is afraid of the dark; the real tragedy of life is when men are afraid of the light.

Author: Margaret Atwood
Quote: I would like to be the air that inhabits you for a moment only. I would like to be that unnoticed and that necessary.

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: Don't stop there. I suppose there are also, what, vampires and werewolves and zombies?""Of course there are. Although you mostly find zombies farther south, where the voudun priests are.""What about mummies? Do they only hang around Egypt?""Don't be ridiculous. No one believes in mummies.

Author: Markus Zusak
Quote: Even death has a heart.

Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
Quote: One ought, every day at least, to hear a little song, read a good poem, see a fine picture, and, if it were possible, to speak a few reasonable words.

Author: William Shakespeare
Quote: You speak an infinite deal of nothing.

Author: Ernest Hemingway
Quote: All you have to do is write one true sentence. Write the truest sentence that you know.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: A cynic is a man who knows the price of everything, and the value of nothing.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: Gravitation is not responsible for people falling in love.

Author: Sarah Dessen
Quote: You know, when it works, love is pretty amazing. It's not overrated. There's a reason for all those songs.

Author: Taylor Swift
Quote: To me, Fearless is not the absense of fear. It's not being completely unafraid. To me, Fearless is having fears. Fearless is having doubts. Lots of them. To me, Fearless is living in spite of those things that scare you to death.

Author: Albert Camus
Quote: But in the end one needs more courage to live than to kill himself.

Author: J. M. Barrie
Quote: The moment you doubt whether you can fly, you cease for ever to be able to do it.

Author: Becca Fitzpatrick
Quote: Say 'provoking' again. Your mouth looks provocative when you do.

Author: Benjamin Disraeli
Quote: There are three types of lies -- lies, damn lies, and statistics.

Author: William Shakespeare
Quote: Words are easy, like the wind; Faithful friends are hard to find.

Author: Haruki Murakami
Quote: I dream. Sometimes I think that's the only right thing to do.

Author: Natalie Babbitt
Quote: Don't be afraid of death; be afraid of an unlived life. You don't have to live forever, you just have to live.

Author: Barbara Kingsolver
Quote: The very least you can do in your life is figure out what you hope for. And the most you can do is live inside that hope. Not admire it from a distance but live right in it, under its roof.

Author: Jane Austen
Quote: I could easily forgive his pride, if he had not mortified mine.

Author: Audrey Niffenegger
Quote: Don't you think it's better to be extremely happy for a short while, even if you lose it, than to be just okay for your whole life?

Author: Mary Oliver
Quote: Someone I loved once gave me a box full of darkness. It took me years to understand that this too, was a gift.

Author: Elizabeth Gilbert
Quote: You need to learn how to select your thoughts just the same way you select your clothes every day. This is a power you can cultivate. If you want to control things in your life so bad, work on the mind. That's the only thing you should be trying to control.

Author: Colette
Quote: You will do foolish things, but do them with enthusiasm.

Author: Charlotte Bronte
Quote: Life appears to me too short to be spent in nursing animosity or registering wrongs.

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: Don't part with your illusions. When they are gone you may still exist, but you have ceased to live.

Author: Albert Camus
Quote: You know what charm is: a way of getting the answer yes without having asked any clear question.

Author: George Bernard Shaw
Quote: You see things; you say, 'Why?' But I dream things that never were; and I say 'Why not?

Author: Logan Pearsall Smith
Quote: People say that life is the thing, but I prefer reading.

Author: J.K. Rowling
Quote: Yeah, Quirrell was a great teacher. There was just that minor drawback of him having Lord Voldemort sticking out of the back of his head!

Author: Corrie ten Boom
Quote: Never be afraid to trust an unknown future to a known God.

Author: Scott Adams
Quote: I love you like a fat kid loves cake!

Author: Pablo Neruda
Quote: Tonight I can write the saddest linesI loved her, and sometimes she loved me too.

Author: Bram Stoker
Quote: There are darknesses in life and there are lights, and you are one of the lights, the light of all lights.

Author: Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche
Quote: We should consider every day lost on which we have not danced at least once.

Author: Niels Bohr
Quote: An expert is a person who has made all the mistakes that can be made in a very narrow field.

Author: Leigh Bardugo
Quote: I will have you without armor, Kaz Brekker. Or I will not have you at all.

Author: Frank McCourt
Quote: You might be poor, your shoes might be broken, but your mind is a palace.

Author: Jonathan Safran Foer
Quote: It was not the feeling of completeness I so needed, but the feeling of not being empty.

Author: Christopher Paolini
Quote: Live in the present, remember the past, and fear not the future, for it doesn't exist and never shall. There is only now.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: It is not that I'm so smart. But I stay with the questions much longer.

Author: Franz Kafka
Quote: I am a cage, in search of a bird.

Author: Nicholas Sparks
Quote: And when her lips met mine, I knew that I could live to be a hundred and visit every country in the world, but nothing would ever compare to that single moment when I first kissed the girl of my dreams and knew that my love would last forever.

Author: Raymond Chandler
Quote: To say goodbye is to die a little.

Author: J.R. Ward
Quote: Welcome to the wonderful world of jealousy, he thought. For the price of admission, you get a splitting headache, a nearly irresistable urge to commit murder, and an inferiority complex. Yippee.

Author: Walter Cronkite
Quote: Whatever the cost of our libraries, the price is cheap compared to that of an ignorant nation.

Author: Rick Riordan
Quote: Don't feel bad, I'm usually about to die.

Author: Arthur C. Clarke
Quote: I'm sure the universe is full of intelligent life. It's just been too intelligent to come here.

Author: George Orwell
Quote: The best books... are those that tell you what you know already.

Author: Steve Maraboli
Quote: Letting go means to come to the realization that some people are a part of your history, but not a part of your destiny.

Author: Zora Neale Hurston
Quote: There are years that ask questions and years that answer.

Author: Stephen Hawking
Quote: We are just an advanced breed of monkeys on a minor planet of a very average star. But we can understand the Universe. That makes us something very special.

Author: Suzanne Collins
Quote: You here to finish me off, Sweetheart?

Author: Stephenie Meyer
Quote: Look after my heart - I've left it with you.

Author: Ally Condie
Quote: Growing apart doesn't change the fact that for a long time we grew side by side; our roots will always be tangled. I'm glad for that.

Author: Mo Willems
Quote: If you ever find yourself in the wrong story, leave.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: The purpose of life is not to be happy. It is to be useful, to be honorable, to be compassionate, to have it make some difference that you have lived and lived well.

Author: Stephen King
Quote: If you want to be a writer, you must do two things above all others: read a lot and write a lot.

Author: Anne Frank
Quote: I can shake off everything as I write; my sorrows disappear, my courage is reborn.

Author: W. P. Kinsella
Quote: Success is getting what you want, happiness is wanting what you get

Author: Franz Kafka
Quote: Don't bend; don't water it down; don't try to make it logical; don't edit your own soul according to the fashion. Rather, follow your most intense obsessions mercilessly.

Author: Charles Dickens
Quote: Suffering has been stronger than all other teaching, and has taught me to understand what your heart used to be. I have been bent and broken, but - I hope - into a better shape.

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: The meek may inherit the earth, but at the moment it belongs to the conceited. Like me.

Author: Virginia Woolf
Quote: If you do not tell the truth about yourself you cannot tell it about other people.

Author: Christopher Paolini
Quote: Books should go where they will be most appreciated, and not sit unread, gathering dust on a forgotten shelf, don't you agree?

Author: Paulo Coelho
Quote: Love is an untamed force. When we try to control it, it destroys us. When we try to imprison it, it enslaves us. When we try to understand it, it leaves us feeling lost and confused.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: When we are tired, we are attacked by ideas we conquered long ago.

Author: Suzanne Collins
Quote: So it's you and a syringe against the Capitol? See, this is why no one lets you make the plans.

Author: Patrick Rothfuss
Quote: Words are pale shadows of forgotten names. As names have power, words have power. Words can light fires in the minds of men. Words can wring tears from the hardest hearts.

Author: Roy T. Bennett
Quote: Be brave to stand for what you believe in even if you stand alone.

Author: George Bernard Shaw
Quote: If you want to tell people the truth, make them laugh, otherwise they'll kill you.

Author: George Carlin
Quote: Have you ever noticed that anybody driving slower than you is an idiot, and anyone going faster than you is a maniac?

Author: Haruki Murakami
Quote: Don't feel sorry for yourself. Only assholes do that.

Author: Marjorie Pay Hinckley
Quote: The only way to get through life is to laugh your way through it. You either have to laugh or cry. I prefer to laugh. Crying gives me a headache.

Author: A.A. Milne
Quote: How do you spell 'love'?" - Piglet"You don't spell it...you feel it." - Pooh

Author: Nicholas Sparks
Quote: Life, he realize, was much like a song. In the beginning there is mystery, in the end there is confirmation, but it's in the middle where all the emotion resides to make the whole thing worthwhile.

Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
Quote: I wasn't actually in love, but I felt a sort of tender curiosity.

Author: Robert Frost
Quote: Education is the ability to listen to almost anything without losing your temper or your self-confidence.

Author: Milan Kundera
Quote: You can't measure the mutual affection of two human beings by the number of words they exchange.

Author: Stewart O'Nan
Quote: You couldn't relive your life, skipping the awful parts, without losing what made it worthwhile. You had to accept it as a whole--like the world, or the person you loved.

Author: Jon Krakauer
Quote: Happiness [is] only real when shared

Author: W. Somerset Maugham
Quote: There are three rules for writing a novel. Unfortunately, no one knows what they are.

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: Travel is fatal to prejudice, bigotry, and narrow-mindedness, and many of our people need it sorely on these accounts. Broad, wholesome, charitable views of men and things cannot be acquired by vegetating in one little corner of the earth all one's lifetime.

Author: Emily Dickinson
Quote: That it will never come again is what makes life so sweet.

Author: Lucy Maud Montgomery
Quote: It's been my experience that you can nearly always enjoy things if you make up your mind firmly that you will.

Author: Elizabeth Peters
Quote: No woman really wants a man to carry her off; she only wants him to want to do it.

Author: Nicholas Sparks
Quote: Every great love starts with a great story...

Author: Aldous Huxley
Quote: But I don't want comfort. I want God, I want poetry, I want real danger, I want freedom, I want goodness. I want sin.

Author: Douglas Adams
Quote: Time is an illusion. Lunchtime doubly so.

Author: Kurt Vonnegut
Quote: Hello babies. Welcome to Earth. It's hot in the summer and cold in the winter. It's round and wet and crowded. On the outside, babies, you've got a hundred years here. There's only one rule that I know of, babies-"God damn it, you've got to be kind.

Author: Sarah J. Maas
Quote: He thinks he'll be remembered as the villain in the story. But I forgot to tell him that the villain is usually the person who locks up the maiden and throws away the key. He was the one who let me out.

Author: Christopher Morley
Quote: There is no mistaking a real book when one meets it. It is like falling in love.

Author: Viktor E. Frankl
Quote: When we are no longer able to change a situation, we are challenged to change ourselves.

Author: Eckhart Tolle
Quote: The past has no power over the present moment.

Author: Mae West
Quote: Every man I meet wants to protect me. I can't figure out what from.

Author: Margaret Thatcher
Quote: In politics, If you want anything said, ask a man. If you want anything done, ask a woman.

Author: Sarah Dessen
Quote: It's a lot easier to be lost than found. It's the reason we're always searching and rarely discovered--so many locks not enough keys.

Author: John Locke
Quote: Reading furnishes the mind only with materials of knowledge; it is thinking that makes what we read ours.

Author: Ernest Hemingway
Quote: Maybe...you'll fall in love with me all over again.""Hell," I said, "I love you enough now. What do you want to do? Ruin me?""Yes. I want to ruin you.""Good," I said. "That's what I want too.

Author: J.K. Rowling
Quote: Why were you lurking under our window?""Yes - yes, good point, Petunia! What were you doing under our windows, boy?""Listening to the news," said Harry in a resigned voice.His aunt and uncle exchanged looks of outrage."Listening to the news! Again?""Well, it changes every day, you see," said Harry.

Author: Cormac McCarthy
Quote: You never know what worse luck your bad luck has saved you from.

Author: Jalal Ad-Din Rumi
Quote: Knock, And He'll open the doorVanish, And He'll make you shine like the sunFall, And He'll raise you to the heavensBecome nothing, And He'll turn you into everything.

Author: Paulo Coelho
Quote: Don't waste your time with explanations: people only hear what they want to hear.

Author: J.M. Barrie
Quote: I'm not young enough to know everything.

Author: Voltaire
Quote: It is forbidden to kill; therefore all murderers are punished unless they kill in large numbers and to the sound of trumpets.

Author: J.K. Rowling
Quote: One can never have enough socks," said Dumbledore. "Another Christmas has come and gone and I didn't get a single pair. People will insist on giving me books.

Author: Rick Riordan
Quote: I nodded, looking at Rachel with respect. "You hit the Lord of the Titans in the eye with a blue plastic hairbrush.

Author: Rodney Dangerfield
Quote: I came from a real tough neighborhood. Once a guy pulled a knife on me. I knew he wasn't a professional, the knife had butter on it.

Author: Jeffrey Eugenides
Quote: Biology gives you a brain. Life turns it into a mind.

Author: Leigh Bardugo
Quote: The heart is an arrow. It demands aim to land true.

Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
Quote: If you treat an individual as he is, he will remain how he is. But if you treat him as if he were what he ought to be and could be, he will become what he ought to be and could be.

Author: Fernando Pessoa
Quote: Literature is the most agreeable way of ignoring life.

Author: William Shakespeare
Quote: Though she be but little, she is fierce!

Author: Joss Whedon
Quote: Remember to always be yourself. Unless you suck.

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: I could not tell you if I loved you the first moment I saw you, or if it was the second or third or fourth. But I remember the first moment I looked at you walking toward me and realized that somehow the rest of the world seemed to vanish when I was with you.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: When it is dark enough, you can see the stars.

Author: Julian Barnes
Quote: Books say: She did this because. Life says: She did this. Books are where things are explained to you; life is where things aren't. I'm not surprised some people prefer books.

Author: Jonathan Safran Foer
Quote: I regret that it takes a life to learn how to live.

Author: John Steinbeck
Quote: All great and precious things are lonely.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: I cannot believe in a God who wants to be praised all the time.

Author: Simon and Garfunkel
Quote: I've got nothing to do today but smile.

Author: John A. Shedd
Quote: A ship is safe in harbor, but that's not what ships are for.

Author: Shel Silverstein
Quote: If you are a dreamer come inIf you are a dreamer a wisher a liarA hoper a pray-er a magic-bean-buyerIf youre a pretender com sit by my fireFor we have some flax golden tales to spinCome in! Come in!

Author: Suzanne Collins
Quote: And then he gives me a smile that just seems so genuinely sweet with just the right touch of shyness that unexpected warmth rushes through me.

Author: Marilyn Monroe
Quote: It's often just enough to be with someone. I don't need to touch them. Not even talk. A feeling passes between you both. You're not alone.

Author: Ayn Rand
Quote: If you don't know, the thing to do is not to get scared, but to learn.

Author: William Arthur Ward
Quote: The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails.

Author: C.S. Lewis
Quote: Crying is all right in its way while it lasts. But you have to stop sooner or later, and then you still have to decide what to do.

Author: Kristin Cashore
Quote: I'm not going to wear a red dress," she said."It would look stunning, My Lady," she called.She spoke to the bubbles gathered on the surface of the water. "If there's anyone I wish to stun at dinner, I'll hit him in the face.

Author: William Shakespeare
Quote: These violent delights have violent endsAnd in their triump die, like fire and powderWhich, as they kiss, consume

Author: Walt Whitman
Quote: What is that you express in your eyes? It seems to me more than all the print I have read in my life.

Author: Annie Dillard
Quote: She read books as one would breathe air, to fill up and live.

Author: Truman Capote
Quote: Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor.

Author: Rick Riordan
Quote: What if it lines up like it did in the Trojan War ... Athena versus Poseidon?""I don't know. But I just know that I'll be fighting next to you.""Why?""Because you're my friend, Seaweed Brain. Any more stupid questions?

Author: Deborah Reber
Quote: Letting go doesn't mean that you don't care about someone anymore. It's just realizing that the only person you really have control over is yourself.

Author: Diana Gabaldon
Quote: I stood still, vision blurring, and in that moment, I heard my heart break. It was a small, clean sound, like the snapping of a flower's stem.

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: Clothes make the man. Naked people have little or no influence on society.

Author: Joseph Campbell
Quote: We must be willing to let go of the life we planned so as to have the life that is waiting for us.

Author: J.K. Rowling
Quote: It is my belief... that the truth is generally preferable to lies.

Author: Robert Jordan
Quote: Any fool knows men and women think differently at times, but the biggest difference is this. Men forget, but never forgive; women forgive, but never forget.

Author: Jorge Luis Borges
Quote: I cannot sleep unless I am surrounded by books.

Author: Marilyn Monroe
Quote: Dogs never bite me. Just humans.

Author: Lao Tzu
Quote: Life is a series of natural and spontaneous changes. Don't resist them; that only creates sorrow. Let reality be reality. Let things flow naturally forward in whatever way they like.

Author: A.A. Milne
Quote: Rivers know this: there is no hurry. We shall get there some day.

Author: L. M. Montgomery
Quote: I'm so glad I live in a world where there are Octobers.

Author: Alice Walker
Quote: The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don't have any.

Author: Lemony Snicket
Quote: All the secrets of the world are contained in books. Read at your own risk.

Author: Lilith Saintcrow
Quote: Better to be strong than pretty and useless.

Author: Suzanne Collins
Quote: I realize only one person will be damaged beyond repair if Peeta dies. Me.

Author: William Shakespeare
Quote: Cowards die many times before their deaths; The valiant never taste of death but once. Of all the wonders that I yet have heard, It seems to me most strange that men should fear; Seeing that death, a necessary end, Will come when it will come.

Author: Rumi
Quote: When I am with you, we stay up all night.When you're not here, I can't go to sleep.Praise God for those two insomnias!And the difference between them.

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: You can't depend on your eyes when your imagination is out of focus.

Author: Thomas Mann
Quote: A writer is someone for whom writing is more difficult than it is for other people.

Author: Bill Watterson
Quote: Sometimes when I'm talking, my words can't keep up with my thoughts. I wonder why we think faster than we speak. Probably so we can think twice.

Author: Lisa Schroeder
Quote: Was it hard?" I ask.Letting go?"Not as hard as holding on to something that wasn't real.

Author: Saul Bellow
Quote: People can lose their lives in libraries. They ought to be warned.

Author: Roy T. Bennett
Quote: Great things happen to those who don't stop believing, trying, learning, and being grateful.

Author: George Bernard Shaw
Quote: The reasonable man adapts himself to the world: the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore all progress depends on the unreasonable man.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: You will find that it is necessary to let things go; simply for the reason that they are heavy. So let them go, let go of them. I tie no weights to my ankles.

Author: Groucho Marx
Quote: From the moment I picked up your book until I put it down, I was convulsed with laughter. Some day I intend reading it.

Author: Margaret Mead
Quote: Children must be taught how to think, not what to think.

Author: J.K. Rowling
Quote: Of all the trees we could've hit, we had to get one that hits back.

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: Everyone is a moon, and has a dark side which he never shows to anybody.

Author: Harper Lee
Quote: I think there's just one kind of folks. Folks.

Author: Henry Miller
Quote: The one thing we can never get enough of is love. And the one thing we never give enough of is love.

Author: Markus Zusak
Quote: Maybe everyone can live beyond what they're capable of.

Author: Roy T. Bennett
Quote: Do not fear failure but rather fear not trying.

Author: Douglas Adams
Quote: A common mistake that people make when trying to design something completely foolproof is to underestimate the ingenuity of complete fools.

Author: Douglas Adams
Quote: A learning experience is one of those things that says, 'You know that thing you just did? Don't do that.

Author: Roy T. Bennett
Quote: Never lose hope. Storms make people stronger and never last forever.

Author: Sylvia Plath
Quote: I shut my eyes and all the world drops dead; I lift my eyes and all is born again.

Author: Jay McInerney
Quote: The capacity for friendship is God's way of apologizing for our families.

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: If you pick up a starving dog and make him prosperous he will not bite you. This is the principal difference between a dog and man.

Author: Madonna
Quote: I'm tough, I'm ambitious, and I know exactly what I want. If that makes me a bitch, okay.

Author: Chuck Palahniuk
Quote: You realize that our mistrust of the future makes it hard to give up the past.

Author: John Muir
Quote: The clearest way into the Universe is through a forest wilderness.

Author: Salvador Dali
Quote: Have no fear of perfection - you'll never reach it.

Author: Leo Tolstoy
Quote: He stepped down, trying not to look long at her, as if she were the sun, yet he saw her, like the sun, even without looking.

Author: Toni Morrison
Quote: You wanna fly, you got to give up the shit that weighs you down.

Author: Bob Marley
Quote: Don't Gain The World & Lose Your Soul, Wisdom Is Better Than Silver Or Gold.

Author: Laurie Halse Anderson
Quote: When people don't express themselves, they die one piece at a time.

Author: Lao Tzu
Quote: A good traveler has no fixed plans and is not intent on arriving.

Author: John Guare
Quote: It's amazing how a little tomorrow can make up for a whole lot of yesterday.

Author: Dan Brown
Quote: Great minds are always feared by lesser minds.

Author: Charles Bukowski
Quote: I loved you like a man loves a woman he never touches, only writes to, keeps little photographs of.

Author: Carl Sagan
Quote: Every one of us is, in the cosmic perspective, precious. If a human disagrees with you, let him live. In a hundred billion galaxies, you will not find another.

Author: Benjamin Franklin
Quote: Three may keep a secret, if two of them are dead.

Author: Bob Marley
Quote: love the life you live.live the life you love.

Author: David Byrne
Quote: Sometimes it's a form of love just to talk to somebody that you have nothing in common with and still be fascinated by their presence.

Author: Victor Hugo
Quote: Music expresses that which cannot be said and on which it is impossible to be silent.

Author: Rick Riordan
Quote: It's funny how humans can wrap their mind around things and fit them into their version of reality.

Author: Jimi Hendrix
Quote: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens

Author: Tamora Pierce
Quote: Every now and then I like to do as I'm told, just to confuse people.

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: You endure what is unbearable, and you bear it. That is all.

Author: William Wordsworth
Quote: The best portion of a good man's life: his little, nameless unremembered acts of kindness and love.

Author: Pablo Neruda
Quote: You can cut all the flowers but you cannot keep Spring from coming.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: All women become like their mothers. That is their tragedy. No man does, and that is his.

Author: Douglas Adams
Quote: Let's think the unthinkable, let's do the undoable. Let us prepare to grapple with the ineffable itself, and see if we may not eff it after all.

Author: Roy T. Bennett
Quote: Always find opportunities to make someone smile, and to offer random acts of kindness in everyday life.

Author: Mother Theresa
Quote: Yesterday is gone. Tomorrow has not yet come. We have only today. Let us begin.

Author: Dan Brown
Quote: Science and religion are not at odds. Science is simply too young to understand.

Author: Abraham Lincoln
Quote: My Best Friend is a person who will give me a book I have not read.

Author: J.K. Rowling
Quote: He was my mum and dad's best friend. He's a convicted murderer, but he's broken out of wizard prison and he's on the run. He likes to keep in touch with me, though...keep up with my news...check if I'm happy...

Author: Kahlil Gibran
Quote: Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls; the most massive characters are seared with scars.

Author: Winston S. Churchill
Quote: Success is stumbling from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.

Author: Dorothy Parker
Quote: Beauty is only skin deep, but ugly goes clean to the bone.

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Quote: And he took her in his arms and kissed her under the sunlit sky, and he cared not that they stood high upon the walls in the sight of many.

Author: Murakami, Haruki
Quote: Anyone who falls in love is searching for the missing pieces of themselves. So anyone who's in love gets sad when they think of their lover. It's like stepping back inside a room you have fond memories of, one you haven't seen in a long time.

Author: Haruki Murakami
Quote: Sometimes when I look at you, I feel I'm gazing at a distant star. It's dazzling, but the light is from tens of thousands of years ago.Maybe the star doesn't even exist any more. Yet sometimes that light seems more real to me than anything.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: Is it so bad, then, to be misunderstood? Pythagoras was misunderstood, and Socrates, and Jesus, and Luther, and Copernicus, and Galileo, and Newton, and every pure and wise spirit that ever took flesh. To be great is to be misunderstood.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: The only way that we can live, is if we grow. The only way that we can grow is if we change. The only way that we can change is if we learn. The only way we can learn is if we are exposed. And the only way that we can become exposed is if we throw ourselves out into the open. Do it. Throw yourself.

Author: Madeline Miller
Quote: And perhaps it is the greater grief, after all, to be left on earth when another is gone.

Author: Jane Austen
Quote: Ah! There is nothing like staying at home, for real comfort.

Author: Douglas Adams
Quote: Would it save you a lot of time if I just gave up and went mad now?

Author: Golda Meir
Quote: Don't be so humble - you are not that great.

Author: Irina Dunn
Quote: A woman without a man is like a fish without a bicycle.

Author: Joshua Slocum
Quote: I had already found that it was not good to be alone, and so made companionship with what there was around me, sometimes with the universe and sometimes with my own insignificant self; but my books were always my friends, let fail all else.

Author: Patricia Highsmith
Quote: My imagination functions much better when I don't have to speak to people.

Author: George R.R. Martin
Quote: Winter is coming.

Author: Ray Bradbury
Quote: Stuff your eyes with wonder, he said, live as if you'd drop dead in ten seconds. See the world. It's more fantastic than any dream made or paid for in factories.

Author: Charles Dickens
Quote: There are books of which the backs and covers are by far the best parts.

Author: William Blake
Quote: A truth that's told with bad intentBeats all the lies you can invent.

Author: Jane Goodall
Quote: What you do makes a difference, and you have to decide what kind of difference you want to make.

Author: Karen Marie Moning
Quote: One day you will kiss a man you can't breathe without, and find that breath is of little consequence.

Author: Dr. Seuss
Quote: Today was good. Today was fun. Tomorrow is another one.

Author: David Levithan
Quote: I am constantly torn between killing myself and killing everyone around me.

Author: Walt Whitman
Quote: Do I contradict myself?Very well then I contradict myself,(I am large, I contain multitudes.)

Author: Dr. Seuss
Quote: If things start happening, don't worry, don't stew, just go right along and you'll start happening too.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: The only way to get rid of temptation is to yield to it.

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: If you don't read the newspaper, you're uninformed. If you read the newspaper, you're mis-informed.

Author: Suzanne Collins
Quote: Yes, frosting. The final defense of the dying.

Author: Jay Asher
Quote: No one knows for certain how much impact they have on the lives of other people. Oftentimes, we have no clue. Yet we push it just the same.

Author: George Carlin
Quote: May the forces of evil become confused on the way to your house.

Author: A.A. Milne
Quote: Promise me you'll never forget me because if I thought you would, I'd never leave.

Author: Bette Midler
Quote: The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.

Author: Franz Kafka
Quote: Youth is happy because it has the capacity to see beauty. Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old.

Author: Becca Fitzpatrick
Quote: You possess other people's...bodies."He accepted that statement with a nod."Do you want to possess my body?""I want to do a lot of things to your body, but that's not one of them.

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Quote: Still round the corner there may wait A new road or a secret gateAnd though I oft have passed them by A day will come at last when IShall take the hidden paths that run West of the Moon, East of the Sun.

Author: Stendhal
Quote: A good book is an event in my life.

Author: Jodi Picoult
Quote: Once you had put the pieces back together, even though you may look intact, you were never quite the same as you'd been before the fall.

Author: Charles Bukowski
Quote: being alone never felt right. sometimes it felt good, but it never felt right.

Author: Kurt Vonnegut
Quote: A purpose of human life, no matter who is controlling it, is to love whoever is around to be loved.

Author: Lewis Carroll
Quote: If I had a world of my own, everything would be nonsense. Nothing would be what it is, because everything would be what it isn't. And contrary wise, what is, it wouldn't be. And what it wouldn't be, it would. You see?

Author: William Blake
Quote: It is easier to forgive an enemy than to forgive a friend.

Author: Socrates
Quote: I cannot teach anybody anything. I can only make them think

Author: Haruki Murakami
Quote: It's like Tolstoy said. Happiness is an allegory, unhappiness a story.

Author: Nick Hornby
Quote: People worry about kids playing with guns, and teenagers watching violent videos; we are scared that some sort of culture of violence will take them over. Nobody worries about kids listening to thousands - literally thousands - of songs about broken hearts and rejection and pain and misery and loss.

Author: Sun Tzu
Quote: Appear weak when you are strong, and strong when you are weak.

Author: John Lennon
Quote: A dream you dream alone is only a dream. A dream you dream together is reality.

Author: J. K. Rowling
Quote: There are some things you can't share without ending up liking each other, and knocking out a twelve-foot mountain troll is one of them.

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: So when the moon's only partly full, you only feel a little wolfy?" "You could say that.""Well, you can go ahead and hang your head out the car window if you feel like it.""I'm a werewolf, not a golden retriever.

Author: Isabel Allende
Quote: The library is inhabited by spirits that come out of the pages at night.

Author: Sharon Salzberg
Quote: You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection

Author: e.e. cummings
Quote: For whatever we lose (like a you or a me),It's always our self we find in the sea.

Author: Neil Gaiman
Quote: Most books on witchcraft will tell you that witches work naked. This is because most books on witchcraft were written by men.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: The world is a dangerous place to live, not because of the people who are evil, but because of the people who don't do anything about it.

Author: Dalai Lama XIV
Quote: Love is the absence of judgment.

Author: C.S. Lewis
Quote: Pain insists upon being attended to. God whispers to us in our pleasures, speaks in our consciences, but shouts in our pains. It is his megaphone to rouse a deaf world.

Author: John Lennon
Quote: One thing you can't hide - is when you're crippled inside.

Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
Quote: I'm not sentimental--I'm as romantic as you are. The idea, you know,is that the sentimental person thinks things will last--the romanticperson has a desperate confidence that they won't.

Author: Gandhi
Quote: Your beliefs become your thoughts, Your thoughts become your words, Your words become your actions, Your actions become your habits, Your habits become your values, Your values become your destiny.

Author: Terry Pratchett
Quote: Wisdom comes from experience. Experience is often a result of lack of wisdom.

Author: Shmuley Boteach
Quote: There is greatness in doing something you hate for the sake of someone you love.

Author: Paulo Coelho
Quote: No matter what he does, every person on earth plays a central role in the history of the world. And normally he doesn't know it.

Author: Paulo Coelho
Quote: We can never judge the lives of others, because each person knows only their own pain and renunciation. It's one thing to feel that you are on the right path, but it's another to think that yours is the only path.

Author: Becca Fitzpatrick
Quote: Keep in mind that people change, but the past doesn't.

Author: Sylvia Plath
Quote: let me live, love, and say it well in good sentences

Author: Veronica Roth
Quote: Then I realize what it is. It's him. Something about him makes me feel like I am about to fall. Or turn to liquid. Or burst into flames.

Author: Veronica Roth
Quote: I suppose a fire that burns that bright is not meant to last.

Author: J.K. Rowling ,
Quote: Youth can not know how age thinks and feels. But old men are guilty if they forget what it was to be young.

Author: Margaret Lee Runbeck
Quote: Silence make the real conversations between friends. Not the saying, but the never needing to say that counts.

Author: Guy de Maupassant
Quote: Our memory is a more perfect world than the universe: it gives back life to those who no longer exist.

Author: Jeaniene Frost
Quote: I'm saying that I'm a moody, insecure, narrow-minded, jealous, borderline homicidal bitch, and I want you to promise me that you're okay with that, because it's who I am, and you're what I need.

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: Always do what is right. It will gratify half of mankind and astound the other.

Author: Laurie Halse Anderson
Quote: You have to know what you stand for, not just what you stand against.

Author: Lewis Carroll ,
Quote: Who in the world am I? Ah, that's the great puzzle.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: The snake which cannot cast its skin has to die. As well the minds which are prevented from changing their opinions; they cease to be mind.

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: Your friend's poetry is terrible," he said.Clary blinked, caught momentarily off guard. "What?""I said his poetry was terrible. It sounds like he ate a dictionary and started vomiting up words at random.

Author: Douglas Adams
Quote: Isn't it enough to see that a garden is beautiful without having to believe that there are fairies at the bottom of it too?

Author: Kazuo Ishiguro
Quote: There was another life that I might have had, but I am having this one.

Author: Anne Bronte
Quote: But he who dares not grasp the thorn Should never crave the rose.

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: I'll just have them change the entry in the demonology textbook from 'almost extinct' to 'not extinct enough for Alec. He prefers his monsters really, really extinct.' Will that make you happy?

Author: Thomas Merton ,
Quote: Art enables us to find ourselves and lose ourselves at the same time.

Author: Sarah Dessen
Quote: You should never be surprised when someone treats you with respect, you should expect it.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: To love oneself is the beginning of a lifelong romance.

Author: Leo Tolstoy
Quote: Respect was invented to cover the empty place where love should be.

Author: Maxine Hong Kingston
Quote: In a time of destruction, create something.

Author: Alan Moore
Quote: People shouldn't be afraid of their government. Governments should be afraid of their people.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: It is absurd to divide people into good and bad. People are either charming or tedious.

Author: Sarah Dessen
Quote: It's all in the view. That's what I mean about forever, too. For any one of us our forever could end in an hour, or a hundred years from now. You never know for sure, so you'd better make every second count.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: Make your own Bible. Select and collect all the words and sentences that in all your readings have been to you like the blast of a trumpet.

Author: Benjamin Franklin
Quote: They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety.

Author: Terry Pratchett
Quote: In the beginning there was nothing, which exploded.

Author: Kurt Vonnegut
Quote: And I asked myself about the present: how wide it was, how deep it was, how much was mine to keep.

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: That's why when major badasses greet each other in movies, they don't say anything, they just nod. The nod means, 'I' am a badass, and I recognize that you, too, are a badass,' but they don't say anything because they're Wolverine and Magneto and it would mess up their vibe to explain.

Author: Terry Pratchett
Quote: Light thinks it travels faster than anything but it is wrong. No matter how fast light travels, it finds the darkness has always got there first, and is waiting for it.

Author: Coco Chanel
Quote: A girl should be two things: who and what she wants.

Author: Arthur Schopenhauer
Quote: Compassion is the basis of morality.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: There is only one thing in the world worse than being talked about, and that is not being talked about.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: I am too fond of reading books to care to write them.

Author: David Mitchell
Quote: A half-read book is a half-finished love affair.

Author: Benjamin Franklin
Quote: Tell me and I forget, teach me and I may remember, involve me and I learn.

Author: Lady Gaga
Quote: Trust is like a mirror, you can fix it if it's broken, but you can still see the crack in that mother fucker's reflection.

Author: Jay Asher
Quote: You can't stop the futureYou can't rewind the pastThe only way to learn the secret...is to press play.

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: It wouldn't be my move," Jace agreed. "First the candy and flowers, then the apology letters, then the ravenous demon hordes. In that order.

Author: Oprah Winfrey
Quote: You can have it all. Just not all at once.

Author: Jennifer L. Armentrout
Quote: Beautiful face. Beautiful body. Horrible attitude. It was the holy trinity of hot boys.

Author: Milan Kundera
Quote: When the heart speaks, the mind finds it indecent to object.

Author: Eoin Colfer
Quote: Confidence is ignorance. If you're feeling cocky, it's because there's something you don't know.

Author: Henry Miller
Quote: A book lying idle on a shelf is wasted ammunition.

Author: Eleanor Roosevelt
Quote: The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.

Author: J.M. Barrie
Quote: Dreams do come true, if only we wish hard enough. You can have anything in life if you will sacrifice everything else for it.

Author: Paulo Coelho
Quote: Nothing in the world is ever completely wrong. Even a stopped clock is right twice a day.

Author: Charles M. Schulz
Quote: What's the good of living if you don't try a few things?

Author: Paulo Coelho
Quote: When you find your path, you must not be afraid. You need to have sufficient courage to make mistakes. Disappointment, defeat, and despair are the tools God uses to show us the way.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.

Author: Dr. Seuss
Quote: All alone! Whether you like it or not, alone is something you'll be quite a lot!

Author: Sylvia Plath
Quote: Yes, I was infatuated with you: I am still. No one has ever heightened such a keen capacity of physical sensation in me. I cut you out because I couldn't stand being a passing fancy. Before I give my body, I must give my thoughts, my mind, my dreams. And you weren't having any of those.

Author: Audrey Hepburn
Quote: There is more to sex appeal than just measurements. I don't need a bedroom to prove my womanliness. I can convey just as much sex appeal, picking apples off a tree or standing in the rain.

Author: Lewis Carroll
Quote: I wonder if the snow loves the trees and fields, that it kisses them so gently? And then it covers them up snug, you know, with a white quilt; and perhaps it says, "Go to sleep, darlings, till the summer comes again.

Author: Ayn Rand
Quote: Learn to value yourself, which means: fight for your happiness.

Author: Madeline Miller
Quote: In the darkness, two shadows, reaching through the hopeless, heavy dusk. Their hands meet, and light spills in a flood like a hundred golden urns pouring out of the sun.

Author: Douglas Adams
Quote: The ships hung in the sky in much the same way that bricks don't.

Author: George Carlin
Quote: Never underestimate the power of stupid people in large groups.

Author: Zig Ziglar
Quote: Lack of direction, not lack of time, is the problem. We all have twenty-four hour days.

Author: C. S. Lewis
Quote: I have learned now that while those who speak about one's miseries usually hurt, those who keep silence hurt more.

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear - not absence of fear.

Author: Marilyn Monroe
Quote: I want to grow old without facelifts. I want to have the courage to be loyal to the face I have made.

Author: Barack Obama
Quote: Change will not come if we wait for some other person, or if we wait for some other time. We are the ones we've been waiting for. We are the change that we seek.

Author: Nicholas Sparks
Quote: The saddest people I've ever met in life are the ones who don't care deeply about anything at all. Passion and satisfaction go hand in hand, and without them, any happiness is only temporary, because there's nothing to make it last.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: Quotation is a serviceable substitute for wit.

Author: Steve Maraboli
Quote: If people refuse to look at you in a new light and they can only see you for what you were, only see you for the mistakes you've made, if they don't realize that you are not your mistakes, then they have to go.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe
Quote: Believe nothing you hear, and only one half that you see.

Author: Rick Riordan
Quote: Dreams like a podcast,Downloading truth in my ears.They tell me cool stuff.""Apollo?" I guess, because I figured nobody else could make a haiku that bad.He put his finger to his lips. "I'm incognito. Call me Fred.""A god named Fred?

Author: C.S. Lewis
Quote: Atheism turns out to be too simple. If the whole universe has no meaning, we should never have found out that it has no meaning...

Author: Frank Zappa
Quote: If you end up with a boring miserable life because you listened to your mom, your dad, your teacher, your priest, or some guy on television telling you how to do your shit, then you deserve it.

Author: Nicholas Sparks
Quote: If conversation was the lyrics, laughter was the music, making time spent together a melody that could be replayed over and over without getting stale.

Author: Elizabeth Gilbert
Quote: When I get lonely these days, I think: So BE lonely, Liz. Learn your way around loneliness. Make a map of it. Sit with it, for once in your life. Welcome to the human experience. But never again use another person's body or emotions as a scratching post for your own unfulfilled yearnings.

Author: Charles Dickens
Quote: Have a heart that never hardens, and a temper that never tires, and a touch that never hurts.

Author: Kurt Vonnegut
Quote: Here is a lesson in creative writing. First rule: Do not use semicolons. They are transvestite hermaphrodites representing absolutely nothing. All they do is show you've been to college.

Author: Plato
Quote: Only the dead have seen the end of war.

Author: Markus Zusak
Quote: A snowball in the face is surely the perfect beginning to a lasting friendship.

Author: Sylvia Plath
Quote: If neurotic is wanting two mutually exclusive things at one and the same time, then I'm neurotic as hell. I'll be flying back and forth between one mutually exclusive thing and another for the rest of my days.

Author: Tahereh Mafi
Quote: I'm oxygen and he's dying to breathe.

Author: W.B. Yeats
Quote: The world is full of magic things, patiently waiting for our senses to grow sharper.

Author: Napoleon Bonaparte
Quote: Never interrupt your enemy when he is making a mistake.

Author: Veronica Roth
Quote: I fell in love with him. But I don't just stay with him by default as if there's no one else available to me. I stay with him because I choose to, every day that I wake up, every day that we fight or lie to each other or disappoint each other. I choose him over and over again, and he chooses me.

Author: C.S. Lewis
Quote: God can't give us peace and happiness apart from Himself because there is no such thing.

Author: Margaret Atwood
Quote: Men are afraid that women will laugh at them. Women are afraid that men will kill them.

Author: Rick Riordan
Quote: Go on with what your heart tells you, or you will lose all.

Author: J.K. Rowling
Quote: Nitwit! Blubber! Oddment! Tweak!

Author: Galway Kinnell
Quote: Let our scars fall in love.

Author: Francois Mauriac
Quote: If you would tell me the heart of a man, tell me not what he reads, but what he rereads.

Author: Jim Morrison
Quote: Expose yourself to your deepest fear; after that, fear has no power, and the fear of freedom shrinks and vanishes. You are free.

Author: Lev Grossman
Quote: If there's a single lesson that life teaches us, it's that wishing doesn't make it so.

Author: Jay Asher
Quote: A lot of you cared, just not enough.

Author: Dorothy Parker
Quote: If you want to know what God thinks of money, just look at the people he gave it to.

Author: Louisa May Alcott
Quote: I am not afraid of storms, for I am learning how to sail my ship.

Author: T.S. Eliot
Quote: Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.

Author: William Wordsworth
Quote: Fill your paper with the breathings of your heart.

Author: Kate DiCamillo
Quote: Open your heart. Someone will come. Someone will come for you. But first you must open your heart.

Author: Marguerite Duras
Quote: Our mothers always remain the strangest, craziest people we've ever met.

Author: Robert Orben
Quote: Illegal aliens have always been a problem in the United States. Ask any Indian.

Author: Dr. Seuss
Quote: From there to here, from here to there, funny things are everywhere!

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: The glory of friendship is not the outstretched hand, not the kindly smile, nor the joy of companionship; it is the spiritual inspiration that comes to one when you discover that someone else believes in you and is willing to trust you with a friendship.

Author: Umberto Eco
Quote: Books are not made to be believed, but to be subjected to inquiry. When we consider a book, we mustn't ask ourselves what it says but what it means...

Author: Zelda Fitzgerald
Quote: She refused to be bored chiefly because she wasn't boring.

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: Kindness is a language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see.

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: Did you ever think that in a past life Alec was an old woman with ninety cats who was always yelling at the neighborhood kids to get off her lawn? Because I do,

Author: C.S. Lewis
Quote: It is a good rule after reading a new book, never to allow yourself another new one till you have read an old one in between.

Author: Susan Sontag
Quote: My library is an archive of longings.

Author: Herbert Hoover
Quote: Older men declare war. But it is youth that must fight and die.

Author: Joseph Heller
Quote: Just because you're paranoid doesn't mean they aren't after you.

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Quote: I am glad you are here with me. Here at the end of all things, Sam.

Author: Rick Riordan
Quote: Families are messy. Immortal families are eternally messy. Sometimes the best we can do is to remind each other that we're related for better or for worse...and try to keep the maiming and killing to a minimum.

Author: Christopher Paolini
Quote: Because you can't argue with all the fools in the world. It's easier to let them have their way, then trick them when they're not paying attention.

Author: Orhan Pamuk
Quote: Happiness is holding someone in your arms and knowing you hold the whole world.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: Behind every exquisite thing that existed, there was something tragic.

Author: John Grisham
Quote: Don't compromise yourself - you're all you have.

Author: Edna St. Vincent Millay
Quote: I know I am but summer to your heart, and not the full four seasons of the year.

Author: Rumi
Quote: silence is the language of god, all else is poor translation.

Author: Dalai Lama XIV
Quote: If you think you are too small to make a difference, try sleeping with a mosquito.

Author: Hemingway, Ernest
Quote: I drink to make other people more interesting.

Author: Emma Donoghue
Quote: Scared is what you're feeling. Brave is what you're doing.

Author: Khaled Hosseini
Quote: There is only one sin. and that is theft... when you tell a lie, you steal someones right to the truth.

Author: David Levithan
Quote: It was a mistake," you said. But the cruel thing was, it felt like the mistake was mine, for trusting you.

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: I thought I'd lie on the floor and writhe in pain for a while," he grunted, "It relaxes me.""It does? Oh - you're being sarcastic. That's a good sign probably.

Author: Alan Bennett
Quote: What she was finding also was how one book led to another, doors kept opening wherever she turned and the days weren't long enough for the reading she wanted to do.

Author: A.A. Milne
Quote: One of the advantages of being disorganized is that one is always having surprising discoveries.

Author: Horace Mann
Quote: A house without books is like a room without windows.

Author: Stephanie Perkins
Quote: The more you know who you are, and what you want, the less you let things upset you.

Author: Leo Tolstoy
Quote: We can know only that we know nothing. And that is the highest degree of human wisdom.

Author: Desmond Tutu
Quote: Do your little bit of good where you are; it's those little bits of good put together that overwhelm the world.

Author: Christopher Hitchens
Quote: Owners of dogs will have noticed that, if you provide them with food and water and shelter and affection, they will think you are god. Whereas owners of cats are compelled to realize that, if you provide them with food and water and shelter and affection, they draw the conclusion that they are gods.

Author: Patrick Rothfuss
Quote: It's the questions we can't answer that teach us the most. They teach us how to think. If you give a man an answer, all he gains is a little fact. But give him a question and he'll look for his own answers.

Author: Coco Chanel
Quote: Don't spend time beating on a wall, hoping to transform it into a door.

Author: Euripides
Quote: Talk sense to a fool and he calls you foolish.

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: It's not gray," Clary felt compelled to point out. "It's green.""If there was such a thing as terminal literalism, you'd have died in childhood," said Jace.

Author: Dr. Seuss
Quote: Then the Grinch thought of something he hadn't before! What if Christmas, he thought, doesn't come from a store. What if Christmas...perhaps...means a little bit more!

Author: J.K. Rowling
Quote: It is a curious thing, Harry, but perhaps those who are best suited to power are those who have never sought it. Those who, like you, have leadership thrust upon them, and take up the mantle because they must, and find to their own surprise that they wear it well.

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: I don't want tea," said Clary, with muffled force. "I want to find my mother. And then I want to find out who took her in the first place, and I want to kill them.""Unfortunately," said Hodge, "we're all out of bitter revenge at the moment, so it's either tea or nothing.

Author: Lois McMaster Bujold
Quote: Reputation is what other people know about you. Honor is what you know about yourself.

Author: John Green
Quote: When did we see each other face-to-face? Not until you saw into my cracks and I saw into yours. Before that, we were just looking at ideas of each other, like looking at your window shade but never seeing inside. But once the vessel cracks, the light can get in. The light can get out.

Author: Margaret Atwood
Quote: A word after a word after a word is power.

Author: J.K. Rowling
Quote: Give her hell from us, Peeves.

Author: Christopher Hitchens
Quote: That which can be asserted without evidence, can be dismissed without evidence.

Author: Gordon B. Hinckley
Quote: Try a little harder to be a little better.

Author: Steve Maraboli
Quote: Cry. Forgive. Learn. Move on. Let your tears water the seeds of your future happiness.

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: Let me give you a piece of advice. The handsome young fellow who's trying to rescue you from a hideous fate is never wrong. Not even if he says the sky is purple and made of hedgehogs.

Author: Beatrix Potter
Quote: There is something delicious about writing the first words of a story. You never quite know where they'll take you.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: Who, being loved, is poor?

Author: Dodie Smith
Quote: There is only one page left to write on. I will fill it with words of only one syllable. I love. I have loved. I will love.

Author: George Orwell
Quote: The creatures outside looked from pig to man, and from man to pig, and from pig to man again; but already it was impossible to say which was which.

Author: Michael Ondaatje
Quote: She had always wanted words, she loved them; grew up on them. Words gave her clarity, brought reason, shape.

Author: Rick Riordan
Quote: Even strength must bow to wisdom sometimes.

Author: C.S. Lewis
Quote: I'm on Aslan's side even if there isn't any Aslan to lead it. I'm going to live as like a Narnian as I can even if there isn't any Narnia.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: If A is a success in life, then A equals x plus y plus z. Work is x; y is play; and z is keeping your mouth shut

Author: Thomas Paine
Quote: The mind once enlightened cannot again become dark.

Author: Martin Luther King Jr.
Quote: Nothing in the world is more dangerous than sincere ignorance and conscientious stupidity.

Author: John Green
Quote: Whenever you read a cancer booklet or website or whatever, they always list depression among the side effects of cancer. But, in fact, depression is not a side effect of cancer. Depression is a side effect of dying.

Author: Lao Tsu
Quote: Those who know do not speak. Those who speak do not know.

Author: Mae West
Quote: I wrote the story myself. It's about a girl who lost her reputation and never missed it.

Author: Lemony Snicket
Quote: Love can change a person the way a parent can change a baby- awkwardly, and often with a great deal of mess.

Author: Honore de Balzac
Quote: Reading brings us unknown friends

Author: George Orwell
Quote: If you want to keep a secret, you must also hide it from yourself.

Author: Chuck Palahniuk
Quote: You are not your job, you're not how much money you have in the bank. You are not the car you drive. You're not the contents of your wallet. You are not your fucking khakis. You are all singing, all dancing crap of the world.

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: You're an idiot.""I've never claimed to be otherwise.

Author: Ernest Hemingway
Quote: When people talk, listen completely. Most people never listen.

Author: Edward J. Stieglitz
Quote: The important thing to you is not how many years in your life, but how much life in your years!

Author: T.S. Eliot
Quote: This is the way the world endsNot with a bang but a whimper.

Author: Jude Deveraux
Quote: My soul will find yours.

Author: Daniel J. Boorstin
Quote: The greatest enemy of knowledge is not ignorance, it is the illusion of knowledge.

Author: Mitch Albom
Quote: All parents damage their children. It cannot be helped. Youth, like pristine glass, absorbs the prints of its handlers. Some parents smudge, others crack, a few shatter childhoods completely into jagged little pieces, beyond repair.

Author: Stephenie Meyer
Quote: Did you know that 'I told you so' has a brother,Jacob?" she asked cutting me off. "His name is 'Shut the hell up'.

Author: Suzanne Collins
Quote: May the odds be ever in your favor!

Author: Kurt Vonnegut
Quote: How nice -- to feel nothing, and still get full credit for being alive.

Author: Suzanne Collins
Quote: I always channel my emotions into my work. That way, I don't hurt anyone but myself.

Author: Anne Sexton
Quote: As it has been said:Love and a coughcannot be concealed.Even a small cough.Even a small love.

Author: William Shakespeare
Quote: By the pricking of my thumbs, Something wicked this way comes.

Author: John Green
Quote: The pleasure of remembering had been taken from me, because there was no longer anyone to remember with. It felt like losing your co-rememberer meant losing the memory itself, as if the things we'd done were less real and important than they had been hours before.

Author: Kurt Vonnegut
Quote: Of all the words of mice and men, the saddest are, "It might have been.

Author: Tennessee Williams
Quote: Time is the longest distance between two places.

Author: Laini Taylor
Quote: Hope can be a powerful force. Maybe there's no actual magic in it, but when you know what you hope for most and hold it like a light within you, you can make things happen, almost like magic.

Author: Neil Gaiman
Quote: Tomorrow may be hell, but today was a good writing day, and on the good writing days nothing else matters.

Author: Robert Frost
Quote: Forgive, O Lord, my little jokes on TheeAnd I'll forgive Thy great big one on me.

Author: Abraham Lincoln
Quote: My concern is not whether God is on our side; my greatest concern is to be on God's side, for God is always right.

Author: Lauren Kate
Quote: Sometimes beautiful things come into our lives out of nowhere. We can't always understand them, but we have to trust in them. I know you want to question everything, but sometimes it pays to just have a little faith.

Author: P.C. Cast
Quote: Remember, darkness does not always equate to evil, just as light does not always bring good.

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: A diary with no drawings of me in it? Where are the torrid fantasies? The romance covers?

Author: Dante Alighieri
Quote: Do not be afraid; our fateCannot be taken from us; it is a gift.

Author: Dr. Seuss
Quote: I meant what I said and I said what I meant. An elephant's faithful one-hundred percent!

Author: Max Lucado
Quote: Faith is not the belief that God will do what you want. It is the belief that God will do what is right.

Author: Roy T. Bennett
Quote: To shine your brightest light is to be who you truly are.

Author: Markus Zusak
Quote: Sometimes you read a book so special that you want to carry it around with you for months after you've finished just to stay near it.

Author: Arundhati Roy
Quote: That's what careless words do. They make people love you a little less.

Author: George Bernard Shaw
Quote: Animals are my friends...and I don't eat my friends.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: In individuals, insanity is rare; but in groups, parties, nations and epochs, it is the rule.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: Crying is for plain women. Pretty women go shopping.

Author: J.K. Rowling
Quote: Ah, music," he said, wiping his eyes. "A magic beyond all we do here!

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: Sometimes, when I have to do something I don't want to do, I pretend I'm a character from a book. It's easier to know what they would do.

Author: Pablo Picasso
Quote: Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.

Author: Margaret Walker
Quote: When I was about eight, I decided that the most wonderful thing, next to a human being, was a book.

Author: Rick Riordan
Quote: Knowing too much of your future is never a good thing.

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
Quote: You must not lose faith in humanity. Humanity is like an ocean; if a few drops of the ocean are dirty, the ocean does not become dirty.

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: They say time heals all wounds, but that presumes the source of the grief is finite

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: I have the simplest tastes. I am always satisfied with the best.

Author: Elie Wiesel
Quote: Friendship marks a life even more deeply than love. Love risks degenerating into obsession, friendship is never anything but sharing.

Author: Abraham Lincoln
Quote: I'm a success today because I had a friend who believed in me and I didn't have the heart to let him down.

Author: Maya Angelou
Quote: You may encounter many defeats, but you must not be defeated. In fact, it may be necessary to encounter the defeats, so you can know who you are, what you can rise from, how you can still come out of it.

Author: Rumi
Quote: Sell your cleverness and buy bewilderment.

Author: J.K. Rowling
Quote: The scar had not pained Harry for nineteen years. All was well.

Author: Lemony Snicket
Quote: Strange as it may seem, I still hope for the best, even though the best, like an interesting piece of mail, so rarely arrives, and even when it does it can be lost so easily.

Author: Kahlil Gibran
Quote: Ever has it been that love knows not its own depth until the hour of separation.

Author: Blaise Pascal
Quote: The heart has its reasons which reason knows not.

Author: Nikolai V. Gogol
Quote: The longer and more carefully we look at a funny story, the sadder it becomes.

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Quote: Courage is found in unlikely places.

Author: Frances Hodgson Burnett
Quote: If you look the right way, you can see that the whole world is a garden.

Author: Paulo Coelho
Quote: Tears are words that need to be written.

Author: Sarah   Williams
Quote: Though my soul may set in darkness, it will rise in perfect light; I have loved the stars too fondly to be fearful of the night.

Author: Edna St. Vincent Millay
Quote: Where you used to be, there is a hole in the world, which I find myself constantly walking around in the daytime, and falling in at night. I miss you like hell.

Author: Dr. Seuss
Quote: Adults are just obsolete children and the hell with them.

Author: John Updike
Quote: It is easy to love people in memory; the hard thing is to love them when they are there in front of you.

Author: Jane Austen
Quote: I must learn to be content with being happier than I deserve.

Author: Charles Lamb
Quote: Tis the privilege of friendship to talk nonsense, and to have her nonsense respected.

Author: Carl Sagan
Quote: The nitrogen in our DNA, the calcium in our teeth, the iron in our blood, the carbon in our apple pies were made in the interiors of collapsing stars. We are made of starstuff.

Author: Rebecca West
Quote: I myself have never been able to find out precisely what feminism is: I only know that people call me a feminist whenever I express sentiments that differentiate me from a doormat.

Author: Yogi Berra
Quote: Always go to other people's funerals, otherwise they won't come to yours.

Author: Nick Hornby
Quote: It's no good pretending that any relationship has a future if your record collections disagree violently or if your favorite films wouldn't even speak to each other if they met at a party.

Author: Santosh Kalwar
Quote: We are addicted to our thoughts. We cannot change anything if we cannot change our thinking.

Author: J.K.Rowling
Quote: Happiness can be found, even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light.

Author: Brian Andreas
Quote: I read once that the ancient Egyptians had fifty words for sand & the Eskimos had a hundred words for snow. I wish I had a thousand words for love, but all that comes to mind is the way you move against me while you sleep & there are no words for that.

Author: Maya Angelou
Quote: Pretty women wonder where my secret lies.I'm not cute or built to suit a fashion model's sizeBut when I start to tell them,They think I'm telling lies.I say,It's in the reach of my armsThe span of my hips,The stride of my step,The curl of my lips.I'm a womanPhenomenally.Phenomenal woman,That's me.

Author: Chuck Palahniuk
Quote: You know how they say you only hurt the ones you love? Well, it works both ways.

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: Even in half demon hunter clothes, Clary thought, he looked like the kind of boy who'd come over your house to pick you up for a date and be polite to your parents and nice to your pets.Jace on the other hand, looked like the kind of boy who'd come over your house and burn it down just for kicks.

Author: Jon Krakauer
Quote: It's not always necessary to be strong, but to feel strong.

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: What do you want?""Just coffee. Black - like my soul.

Author: Robert Frost
Quote: If we couldn't laugh we would all go insane.

Author: Roy T. Bennett
Quote: Sometimes you have to lose all you have to find out who you truly are.

Author: Arthur William Edgar O'Shaughnessy
Quote: We are the music makers, and we are the dreamers of dreams.

Author: Jack Kerouac
Quote: I like too many things and get all confused and hung-up running from one falling star to another till i drop. This is the night, what it does to you. I had nothing to offer anybody except my own confusion.

Author: Stephanie Perkins
Quote: Is it possible for home to be a person and not a place?

Author: Margaret Atwood
Quote: Don't let the bastards grind you down.

Author: Mitch Albom
Quote: Lost love is still love. It takes a different form, that's all. You can't see their smile or bring them food or tousle their hair or move them around a dance floor. But when those senses weaken another heightens. Memory. Memory becomes your partner. You nurture it. You hold it. You dance with it.

Author: Bill Cosby
Quote: A word to the wise ain't necessary, it's the stupid ones who need advice.

Author: jonathan safran foer
Quote: Time was passing like a hand waving from a train I wanted to be on. I hope you never have to think about anything as much as I think about you.

Author: Robert Louis Stevenson
Quote: I travel not to go anywhere, but to go. I travel for travel's sake. The great affair is to move.

Author: Anne Frank
Quote: I don't think of all the misery, but of the beauty that still remains.

Author: Sarah Dessen
Quote: I like flaws. I think they make things interesting.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: Children begin by loving their parents; as they grow older they judge them; sometimes they forgive them.

Author: Michael Crichton
Quote: If you don't know history, then you don't know anything. You are a leaf that doesn't know it is part of a tree.

Author: Adrienne Rich
Quote: There must be those among whom we can sit down and weep and still be counted as warriors.

Author: Charles Dickens
Quote: A wonderful fact to reflect upon, that every human creature is constituted to be that profound secret and mystery to every other.

Author: Ursula K. Le Guin
Quote: It is good to have an end to journey toward; but it is the journey that matters, in the end.

Author: Suzanne Collins
Quote: I must have loved you a lot.

Author: Ray Bradbury
Quote: You must write every single day of your life... You must lurk in libraries and climb the stacks like ladders to sniff books like perfumes and wear books like hats upon your crazy heads... may you be in love every day for the next 20,000 days. And out of that love, remake a world.

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: It's not the size of the dog in the fight, it's the size of the fight in the dog.

Author: Lao Tzu
Quote: When you are content to be simply yourself and don't compare or compete, everyone will respect you.

Author: Sophocles
Quote: One wordFrees us of all the weight and pain of life:That word is love.

Author: Michelle Hodkin
Quote: Thinking something does not make it true. Wanting something does not make it real.

Author: Bill Watterson
Quote: You know, Hobbes, some days even my lucky rocket ship underpants don't help.

Author: Rick Riordan
Quote: We're staying together," he promised. "You're not getting away from me. Never again.

Author: Kiera Cass
Quote: True love is usually the most inconvenient kind.

Author: William Goldman
Quote: When I was your age, television was called books.

Author: Bob Marley
Quote: The greatness of a man is not in how much wealth he acquires, but in his integrity and his ability to affect those around him positively.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe
Quote: From childhood's hour I have not been. As others were, I have not seen. As others saw, I could not awaken. My heart to joy at the same tone. And all I loved, I loved alone.

Author: Emilie Autumn
Quote: It gives me strength to have somebody to fight for; I can never fight for myself, but, for others, I can kill.

Author: J.K. Rowling
Quote: Ginny!" said Mr. Weasley, flabbergasted. "Haven't I taught you anything? What have I always told you? Never trust anything that can think for itself if you can't see where it keeps its brain?

Author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
Quote: The love of learning, the sequestered nooks,And all the sweet serenity of books

Author: J.D. Salinger
Quote: I am always saying "Glad to've met you" to somebody I'm not at all glad I met. If you want to stay alive, you have to say that stuff, though.

Author: James Baldwin
Quote: Children have never been very good at listening to their elders, but they have never failed to imitate them.

Author: C.S. Lewis
Quote: You can make anything by writing.

Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
Quote: There are only the pursued, the pursuing, the busy and the tired.

Author: Harlan Ellison
Quote: You are not entitled to your opinion. You are entitled to your informed opinion. No one is entitled to be ignorant.

Author: E.E. Cummings
Quote: Trust your heart if the seas catch fire, live by love though the stars walk backward.

Author: Stieg Larsson
Quote: Friendship- my definition- is built on two things. Respect and trust. Both elements have to be there. And it has to be mutual. You can have respect for someone, but if you don't have trust, the friendship will crumble.

Author: Jim Butcher
Quote: When everything goes to hell, the people who stand by you without flinching -- they are your family.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: Black holes are where God divided by zero.

Author: Robert Louis Stevenson
Quote: Life is not a matter of holding good cards, but of playing a poor hand well.

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: Jace shook his blond head in exasperation. "You had to make a crazy jail friend, didn't you? You couldn't just count ceiling tiles or tame a pet mouse like normal prisoners do?

Author: Jodi Picoult
Quote: If you have a sister and she dies, do you stop saying you have one? Or are you always a sister, even when the other half of the equation is gone?

Author: Joyce Carol Oates
Quote: Reading is the sole means by which we slip, involuntarily, often helplessly, into another's skin, another's voice, another's soul.

Author: Neil Gaiman
Quote: Being a writer is a very peculiar sort of a job: it's always you versus a blank sheet of paper (or a blank screen) and quite often the blank piece of paper wins.

Author: Bob Dylan
Quote: Behind every beautiful thing, there's some kind of pain.

Author: J. K. Rowling
Quote: What happened down in the dungeons between you and Professor Quirrell is a complete secret, so, naturally the whole school knows.

Author: Virginia Woolf
Quote: Writing is like sex. First you do it for love, then you do it for your friends, and then you do it for money.

Author: Sarah J. Maas
Quote: My name is Celaena Sardothien. But it makes no difference if my name's Celaena or Lillian or Bitch, because I'd still beat you, no matter what you call me.

Author: Arrigo Boito
Quote: When I saw you I fell in love, and you smiled because you knew.

Author: Cornelia Funke
Quote: Books have to be heavy because the whole world's inside them.

Author: Stephen Chbosky
Quote: please believe that things are good with me, and even when they're not, they will be soon enough. And i will always believe the same about you.

Author: Steve Martin
Quote: Some people have a way with words, and other people...oh, uh, not have way.

Author: W.C. Fields
Quote: It ain't what they call you, it's what you answer to.

Author: Rick Riordan
Quote: It's hard to enjoy practical jokes when your whole life feels like one.

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: I've lived through some terrible things in my life, some of which actually happened.

Author: Marcel Proust
Quote: The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes.

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
Quote: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.

Author: Roy T. Bennett
Quote: Stop comparing yourself to other people, just choose to be happy and live your own life.

Author: Nicholas Sparks
Quote: I fell in love with her when we were together, then fell deeper in love with her in the years we were apart.

Author: Richelle Mead
Quote: The only thing better than imagining Dimitri carrying me in his arms was imagining him shirtless while carrying me in his arms.

Author: Suzanne Collins
Quote: You're a painter. You're a baker. You like to sleep with the windows open. You never take sugar in your tea. And you always double-knot your shoelaces.

Author: Leonard Cohen
Quote: There is a crack in everything.That's how the light gets in.

Author: Ben Okri
Quote: Stories can conquer fear, you know. They can make the heart bigger.

Author: Stephenie Meyer
Quote: Forbidden to remember, terrified to forget; it was a hard line to walk.

Author: Virginia Woolf
Quote: As a woman I have no country. As a woman I want no country. As a woman, my country is the whole world.

Author: Nicholas Sparks
Quote: The emotion that can break your heart is sometimes the very one that heals it...

Author: Sarah Dessen
Quote: Anyone can hide. Facing up to things, working through them, that's what makes you strong.

Author: Paulo Coelho
Quote: Don't give in to your fears. If you do, you won't be able to talk to your heart.

Author: Harvey Fierstein
Quote: Never be bullied into silence. Never allow yourself to be made a victim. Accept no one's definition of your life, but define yourself.

Author: Roy T. Bennett
Quote: You are not rich until you have a rich heart.

Author: Boris Pasternak
Quote: I don't like people who have never fallen or stumbled. Their virtue is lifeless and it isn't of much value. Life hasn't revealed its beauty to them.

Author: Roy T. Bennett
Quote: You never change your life until you step out of your comfort zone; change begins at the end of your comfort zone.

Author: Chuck Palahniuk
Quote: When we don't know who to hate, we hate ourselves.

Author: J.M. Barrie
Quote: When the first baby laughed for the first time, its laugh broke into a thousand pieces, and they all went skipping about, and that was the beginning of fairies.

Author: Edward Abbey
Quote: Better a cruel truth than a comfortable delusion.

Author: Anais Nin
Quote: I must be a mermaid, Rango. I have no fear of depths and a great fear of shallow living.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: Selfishness is not living as one wishes to live, it is asking others to live as one wishes to live.

Author: Harper Lee
Quote: Sometimes the Bible in the hand of one man is worse than a whisky bottle in the hand of (another)... There are just some kind of men who - who're so busy worrying about the next world they've never learned to live in this one, and you can look down the street and see the results.

Author: Roy T. Bennett
Quote: Do not let the memories of your past limit the potential of your future. There are no limits to what you can achieve on your journey through life, except in your mind.

Author: Phyllis Diller
Quote: A smile is a curve that sets everything straight.

Author: Dr. Seuss
Quote: Remember me and smile, for it's better to forget than to remember me and cry.

Author: Tim Burton
Quote: One person's craziness is another person's reality.

Author: Chuck Palahniuk
Quote: You are not special. You're not a beautiful and unique snowflake. You're the same decaying organic matter as everything else. We're all part of the same compost heap. We're all singing, all dancing crap of the world.

Author: Robert Louis Stevenson
Quote: I kept always two books in my pocket, one to read, one to write in.

Author: Elizabeth Wurtzel
Quote: That's the thing about depression: A human being can survive almost anything, as long as she sees the end in sight. But depression is so insidious, and it compounds daily, that it's impossible to ever see the end.

Author: Charles Darwin
