Quote: If I had my life to live over again, I would have made a rule to read some poetry and listen to some music at least once every week.

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Quote: May it be a light to you in dark places, when all other lights go out.

Author: Andy Warhol
Quote: They always say time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself.

Author: Stieg Larsson
Quote: What she had realized was that love was that moment when your heart was about to burst.

Author: Neil Gaiman
Quote: Things need not have happened to be true. Tales and dreams are the shadow-truths that will endure when mere facts are dust and ashes, and forgot.

Author: Yann Martel
Quote: To choose doubt as a philosophy of life is akin to choosing immobility as a means of transportation.

Author: P.C. Cast  Kristin Cast
Quote: If you have good friends, no matter how much life is sucking , they can make you laugh.

Author: Jack Kornfield
Quote: In the endthese things matter most:How well did you love?How fully did you live?How deeply did you let go?

Author: Martin Luther King Jr.
Quote: The ultimate measure of a man is not where he stands in moments of comfort and convenience, but where he stands at times of challenge and controversy.

Author: Mother Teresa
Quote: Do not think that love in order to be genuine has to be extraordinary. What we need is to love without getting tired. Be faithful in small things because it is in them that your strength lies.

Author: Charles Lamb
Quote: I always arrive late at the office, but I make up for it by leaving early.

Author: Jo Walton
Quote: It doesn't matter. I have books, new books, and I can bear anything as long as there are books.

Author: Lawrence Ferlinghetti
Quote: If you're too open-minded; your brains will fall out.

Author: Sheng Wang
Quote: Why do people say "grow some balls"? Balls are weak and sensitive. If you wanna be tough, grow a vagina. Those things can take a pounding.

Author: J.K. Rowling
Quote: I hope you're pleased with yourselves. We could all have been killed - or worse, expelled. Now if you don't mind, I'm going to bed.

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: Whatever you are physically...male or female, strong or weak, ill or healthy--all those things matter less than what your heart contains. If you have the soul of a warrior, you are a warrior. All those other things, they are the glass that contains the lamp, but you are the light inside.

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: My rapier wit hides my inner pain.

Author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
Quote: I say let the world go to hell, but I should always have my tea.

Author: Bob Marley
Quote: Better to die fighting for freedom then be a prisoner all the days of your life.

Author: Lauren Oliver
Quote: I'd rather die my way than live yours.

Author: Maya Angelou
Quote: Try to be a rainbow in someone's cloud.

Author: Heinrich Heine
Quote: Where words leave off, music begins.

Author: Glen Cook
Quote: Morning is wonderful. Its only drawback is that it comes at such an inconvenient time of day.

Author: Ayn Rand
Quote: I could die for you. But I couldn't, and wouldn't, live for you.

Author: Anais Nin
Quote: I am lonely, yet not everybody will do. I don't know why, some people fill the gaps and others emphasize my loneliness. In reality those who satisfy me are those who simply allow me to live with my ''idea of them.

Author: John Green
Quote: Headline?" he asked."'Swing Set Needs Home,'" I said."'Desperately Lonely Swing Set Needs Loving Home,'" he said."'Lonely, Vaguely Pedophilic Swing Set Seeks the Butts of Children,'" I said.

Author: Edmund Burke
Quote: The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.

Author: Terry Pratchett
Quote: If you have enough book space, I don't want to talk to you.

Author: Rainbow Rowell
Quote: Holding Eleanor's hand was like holding a butterfly. Or a heartbeat. Like holding something complete, and completely alive.

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: Education: the path from cocky ignorance to miserable uncertainty.

Author: David Foster Wallace
Quote: The truth will set you free. But not until it is finished with you.

Author: Aung San Suu Kyi
Quote: The only real prison is fear, and the only real freedom is freedom from fear

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Quote: It's the job that's never started as takes longest to finish.

Author: Alexandre Dumas
Quote: I am not proud, but I am happy; and happiness blinds, I think, more than pride.

Author: Virginia Woolf
Quote: I can only note that the past is beautiful because one never realises an emotion at the time. It expands later, and thus we don't have complete emotions about the present, only about the past.

Author: Groucho Marx
Quote: Learn from the mistakes of others. You can never live long enough to make them all yourself.

Author: Peter S. Beagle
Quote: Great heroes need great sorrows and burdens, or half their greatness goes unnoticed. It is all part of the fairy tale.

Author: John Lennon
Quote: There's nowhere you can be that isn't where you're meant to be...

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: Everything must be made as simple as possible. But not simpler.

Author: Dr. Seuss
Quote: They say I'm old-fashioned, and live in the past, but sometimes I think progress progresses too fast!

Author: Guy de Maupassant
Quote: Words dazzle and deceive because they are mimed by the face. But black words on a white page are the soul laid bare.

Author: Rita Mae Brown
Quote: Sorrow is how we learn to love. Your heart isn't breaking. It hurts because it's getting larger. The larger it gets, the more love it holds.

Author: George Orwell
Quote: The most effective way to destroy people is to deny and obliterate their own understanding of their history.

Author: Toni Morrison
Quote: Freeing yourself was one thing, claiming ownership of that freed self was another.

Author: Mae West
Quote: Between two evils, I always pick the one I never tried before.

Author: George R.R. Martin
Quote: When the snows fall and the white winds blow, the lone wolf dies but the pack survives.

Author: Lewis Carroll
Quote: Curiouser and curiouser!

Author: Audre Lorde
Quote: Your silence will not protect you.

Author: Zadie Smith
Quote: The past is always tense, the future perfect.

Author: Charles Dickens
Quote: It is a far, far better thing that I do, than I have ever done; it is a far, far better rest that I go to than I have ever known.

Author: Charles Dickens
Quote: Heaven knows we need never be ashamed of our tears, for they are rain upon the blinding dust of earth, overlying our hard hearts. I was better after I had cried, than before--more sorry, more aware of my own ingratitude, more gentle.

Author: Nelson Mandela
Quote: I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.

Author: Harper Lee
Quote: Atticus, he was real nice.""Most people are, Scout, when you finally see them.

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: Patience, grasshopper," said Maia. "Good things come to those who wait.""I always thought that was 'Good things come to those who do the wave,'" said Simon. "No wonder I've been so confused all my life.

Author: Jane Austen
Quote: The Very first moment I beheld him, my heart was irrevocably gone.

Author: J.K. Rowling
Quote: The last enemy that shall be destroyed is death.

Author: Alexander Pope
Quote: To err is human, to forgive, divine.

Author: Kurt Cobain
Quote: I'd rather be hated for who I am, than loved for who I am not.

Author: Simone de Beauvoir
Quote: I am too intelligent, too demanding, and too resourceful for anyone to be able to take charge of me entirely. No one knows me or loves me completely. I have only myself

Author: C.S. Lewis
Quote: No one ever told me that grief felt so like fear.

Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
Quote: Whenever you feel like criticizing any one...just remember that all the people in this world haven't had the advantages that you've had.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: All I have seen teaches me to trust the Creator for all I have not seen.

Author: Elizabeth Gilbert
Quote: To be fully seen by somebody, then, and be loved anyhow - this is a human offering that can border on miraculous.

Author: Rumi
Quote: In your light I learn how to love. In your beauty, how to make poems. You dance inside my chest where no-one sees you, but sometimes I do, and that sight becomes this art.

Author: George R.R. Martin
Quote: The man who passes the sentence should swing the sword. If you would take a man's life, you owe it to him to look into his eyes and hear his final words. And if you cannot bear to do that, then perhaps the man does not deserve to die.

Author: Marilyn Monroe
Quote: I don't know who invented high heels, but all women owe him a lot!

Author: Roy T. Bennett
Quote: Let the improvement of yourself keep you so busy that you have no time to criticize others.

Author: E.L. James
Quote: Sometimes I wonder if there's something wrong with me. Perhaps I've spent too long in the company of my literary romantic heroes, and consequently my ideals and expectations are far too high.

Author: Jasper Fforde
Quote: If the real world were a book, it would never find a publisher. Overlong, detailed to the point of distraction-and ultimately, without a major resolution.

Author: J.M. Barrie
Quote: Second star to the right and straight on 'til morning.

Author: Nicole Krauss
Quote: When will you learn that there isn't a word for everything?

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: Alec looked at her and shook his head. "How do you manage never to get mud on your clothes?"Isabelle shrugged philosophically. "I'm pure at heart. It repels the dirt.

Author: Anne Rice
Quote: Evil is always possible. And goodness is eternally difficult.

Author: Pittacus Lore
Quote: When you have lost hope, you have lost everything. And when you think all is lost, when all is dire and bleak, there is always hope.

Author: Thomas Babington Macaulay
Quote: What a blessing it is to love books as I love them;- to be able to converse with the dead, and to live amidst the unreal!

Author: Albert Camus
Quote: Blessed are the hearts that can bend; they shall never be broken.

Author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
Quote: Man only likes to count his troubles; he doesn't calculate his happiness.

Author: Bill Watterson
Quote: I'm killing time while I wait for life to shower me with meaning and happiness.

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: The best way to cheer yourself is to try to cheer someone else up.

Author: J.R. Ward
Quote: I was dead until you found me, though I breathed. I was sightless, though I could see. And then you came...and I was awakened.

Author: Aristotle
Quote: Educating the mind without educating the heart is no education at all.

Author: Plato
Quote: The price good men pay for indifference to public affairs is to be ruled by evil men.

Author: Louis L'Amour
Quote: Once you have read a book you care about, some part of it is always with you.

Author: Rumi Jalalud-Din
Quote: Ignore those that make you fearful and sad, that degrade you back towards disease and death.

Author: John Green
Quote: And then something invisible snapped insider her, and that which had come together commenced to fall apart.

Author: Paulo Coelho
Quote: The two hardest tests on the spiritual road are the patience to wait for the right moment and the courage not to be disappointed with what we encounter.

Author: Voltaire
Quote: Those who can make you believe absurdities, can make you commit atrocities.

Author: Joss Whedon
Quote: I write to give myself strength. I write to be the characters that I am not. I write to explore all the things I'm afraid of.

Author: Abraham Lincoln
Quote: Books serve to show a man that those original thoughts of his aren't very new after all.

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: You might want to lie down," Magnus advised. "I find that it helps when the crushing sense of horrible realization sets in.

Author: Rick Riordan
Quote: The world was collapsing, and the only thing that really mattered to me was that she was alive.

Author: Anne Frank
Quote: Parents can only give good advice or put them on the right paths, but the final forming of a person's character lies in their own hands.

Author: Rick Riordan
Quote: Um...is that thing tame?" Frank said.The horse whinnied angrily."I don't think so," Percy guessed. "He just said, 'I will trample you to death, silly Chinese Canadian baby man'.

Author: Neil Gaiman
Quote: This is how you do it: you sit down at the keyboard and you put one word after another until its done. It's that easy, and that hard.

Author: Harper Lee
Quote: They're certainly entitled to think that, and they're entitled to full respect for their opinions... but before I can live with other folks I've got to live with myself. The one thing that doesn't abide by majority rule is a person's conscience.

Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
Quote: In my younger and more vulnerable years my father gave me some advice that I've been turning over in my mind ever since."Whenever you feel like criticizing any one," he told me, "just remember that all the people in this world haven't had the advantages that you've had.

Author: Annie Proulx
Quote: You should write because you love the shape of stories and sentences and the creation of different words on a page. Writing comes from reading, and reading is the finest teacher of how to write.

Author: Candace Bushnell
Quote: Maybe our girlfriends are our soulmates and guys are just people to have fun with.

Author: Reginald Vincent Holmes
Quote: The earth has its music for those who will listen

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: When one is in love, one always begins by deceiving one's self, and one always ends by deceiving others. That is what the world calls a romance.

Author: Charles Darwin
Quote: A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.

Author: J.K. Rowling
Quote: We do not need magic to transform our world. We carry all of the power we need inside ourselves already.

Author: Fannie Flagg
Quote: I wonder how many people don't get the one they want, but end up with the one they're supposed to be with.

Author: Louise Erdrich
Quote: When we are young, the words are scattered all around us. As they are assembled by experience, so also are we, sentence by sentence, until the story takes shape.

Author: Oprah Winfrey
Quote: Be thankful for what you have; you'll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don't have, you will never, ever have enough.

Author: Sun Tzu
Quote: The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.

Author: Mitch Albom
Quote: Holding anger is a poison...It eats you from inside...We think that by hating someone we hurt them...But hatred is a curved blade...and the harm we do to others...we also do to ourselves.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: I have nothing to declare except my genius.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: The earth laughs in flowers.

Author: Mitch Albom
Quote: When someone is in your heart, they're never truly gone. They can come back to you, even at unlikely times.

Author: Hafiz
Quote: Even After All this timeThe Sun never says to the Earth,"You owe me."LookWhat happensWith a love like that,It lights the whole sky.

Author: Haruki Murakami
Quote: But I didn't understand then. That I could hurt somebody so badly she would never recover. That a person can, just by living, damage another human being beyond repair.

Author: Ian Fleming
Quote: You only live twice:Once when you are bornAnd once when you look death in the face

Author: Becca Fitzpatrick
Quote: I don't go out with strangers," I said."Good thing I do. I'll pick you up at five.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: We are each our own devil, and we make this world our hell.

Author: Marilyn Monroe
Quote: Wanting to be someone else is a waste of the person you are.

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: I know it's wrong - God, it's all kinds of wrong - but I just want to lie down with you and wake up with you, just once, just once ever in my life.

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
Quote: The future depends on what you do today.

Author: Moliere
Quote: Trees that are slow to grow bear the best fruit.

Author: Leo Tolstoy
Quote: Only people who are capable of loving strongly can also suffer great sorrow, but this same necessity of loving serves to counteract their grief and heals them.

Author: Chuck Palahniuk
Quote: If death meant just leaving the stage long enough to change costume and come back as a new character...Would you slow down? Or speed up?

Author: Jack Kerouac
Quote: The only truth is music.

Author: Sean O'Casey
Quote: Laughter is wine for the soul - laughter soft, or loud and deep, tinged through with seriousness - the hilarious declaration made by man that life is worth living.

Author: Dr. Seuss
Quote: If you never did you should. These things are fun and fun is good.

Author: Martin Luther King Jr.
Quote: Intelligence plus character-that is the goal of true education.

Author: J.D. Salinger
Quote: The mark of the immature man is that he wants to die nobly for a cause, while the mark of the mature man is that he wants to live humbly for one.

Author: Steven Spielberg
Quote: Only a generation of readers will spawn a generation of writers.

Author: Ned Vizzini
Quote: I can't eat and I can't sleep. I'm not doing well in terms of being a functional human, you know?

Author: J.K. Rowling
Quote: You care so much you feel as though you will bleed to death with the pain of it.

Author: Epicurus
Quote: Do not spoil what you have by desiring what you have not; remember that what you now have was once among the things you only hoped for.

Author: Stephen Fry
Quote: Books are no more threatened by Kindle than stairs by elevators.

Author: Ray Bradbury
Quote: There is more than one way to burn a book. And the world is full of people running about with lit matches.

Author: Henry David Thoreau
Quote: The question is not what you look at, but what you see.

Author: Haruki Murakami
Quote: I was always hungry for love. Just once, I wanted to know what it was like to get my fill of it -- to be fed so much love I couldn't take any more. Just once.

Author: Lemony Snicket
Quote: ...you know that a good, long session of weeping can often make you feel better, even if your circumstances have not changed one bit.

Author: Lauren Conrad
Quote: Don't cry over someone who wouldn't cry over you.

Author: Pat  Monahan
Quote: You can only be young once. But you can always be immature.

Author: Chuck Palahniuk
Quote: The things you used to own, now they own you.

Author: Leo Tolstoy
Quote: If, then, I were asked for the most important advice I could give, that which I considered to be the most useful to the men of our century, I should simply say: in the name of God, stop a moment, cease your work, look around you.

Author: Rick Riordan
Quote: You deal with mythological stuff for a few years, you learn that paradises are usually places where you get killed.

Author: Johnny Depp
Quote: If someone were to harm my family or a friend or somebody I love, I would eat them. I might end up in jail for 500 years, but I would eat them.

Author: Frank Zappa
Quote: If you want to get laid, go to college. If you want an education, go to the library.

Author: Aristotle
Quote: Hope is a waking dream.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: We can't be afraid of change. You may feel very secure in the pond that you are in, but if you never venture out of it, you will never know that there is such a thing as an ocean, a sea. Holding onto something that is good for you now, may be the very reason why you don't have something better.

Author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
Quote: The good thing about science is that it's true whether or not you believe in it.

Author: C.S. Lewis
Quote: He died not for men, but for each man. If each man had been the only man made, He would have done no less.

Author: Colleen Hoover
Quote: I got schooled this yearbyaboy.A boy that I'm seriously, deeply, madly, incredibly, and undeniably in

Author: Francois Duc de la Rochefoucauld
Quote: Absence diminishes small loves and increases great ones, as the wind blows out the candle and fans the bonfire.

Author: George Bernard Shaw
Quote: Those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything.

Author: Mitch Albom
Quote: Have you ever lost someone you love and wanted one more conversation, one more chance to make up for the time when you thought they would be here forever? If so, then you know you can go your whole life collecting days, and none will outweigh the one you wish you had back.

Author: Jane Yolen
Quote: Literature is a textually transmitted disease, normally contracted in childhood.

Author: Caroline Gordon
Quote: A well-composed book is a magic carpet on which we are wafted to a world that we cannot enter in any other way.

Author: Ray Bradbury
Quote: We need not to be let alone. We need to be really bothered once in a while. How long is it since you were really bothered? About something important, about something real?

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: Anybody can sympathise with the sufferings of a friend, but it requires a very fine nature to sympathise with a friend's success.

Author: E.E. Cummings
Quote: We do not believe in ourselves until someone reveals that deep inside us something is valuable, worth listening to, worthy of our trust, sacred to our touch. Once we believe in ourselves we can risk curiosity, wonder, spontaneous delight or any experience that reveals the human spirit.

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: If you're texting Magnus to say 'I think u r kewl,' I'm going to kill you.""Who's Magnus?" Max inquired."He's a warlock," said Alec."A sexy, sexy warlock," Isabelle told Max, ignoring Alec's look of total fury."But warlocks are bad," protested Max, looking baffled."Exactly," said Isabelle.

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: If no one cares for you at all, do you even really exist?

Author: Nicole Krauss
Quote: there are two types of people in the world: those who prefer to be sad among others, and those who prefer to be sad alone.

Author: James Baldwin
Quote: I imagine one of the reasons people cling to their hates so stubbornly is because they sense, once hate is gone, they will be forced to deal with pain.

Author: John Keats
Quote: Heard melodies are sweet, but those unheard, are sweeter

Author: Melissa Marr
Quote: Sometimes love means letting go when you want to hold on tighter.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: A man's face is his autobiography. A woman's face is her work of fiction.

Author: Charles Baudelaire
Quote: Always be a poet, even in prose.

Author: Victor Hugo
Quote: The power of a glance has been so much abused in love stories, that it has come to be disbelieved in. Few people dare now to say that two beings have fallen in love because they have looked at each other. Yet it is in this way that love begins, and in this way only.

Author: Steve Maraboli
Quote: Incredible change happens in your life when you decide to take control of what you do have power over instead of craving control over what you don't.

Author: John Lennon
Quote: I believe in God, but not as one thing, not as an old man in the sky. I believe that what people call God is something in all of us. I believe that what Jesus and Mohammed and Buddha and all the rest said was right. It's just that the translations have gone wrong.

Author: Richelle Mead
Quote: I know how devastated you must be to miss me, but leave a message, and I'll try to ease your agony

Author: Tiffanie DeBartolo
Quote: Did you really want to die?""No one commits suicide because they want to die.""Then why do they do it?""Because they want to stop the pain.

Author: Katherine Anne Porter
Quote: The past is never where you think you left it.

Author: C.S. Lewis
Quote: The homemaker has the ultimate career. All other careers exist for one purpose only - and that is to support the ultimate career.

Author: Steve Maraboli
Quote: I want to be in a relationship where you telling me you love me is just a ceremonious validation of what you already show me.

Author: Paulo Coelho
Quote: There are moments when troubles enter our lives and we can do nothing to avoid them.But they are there for a reason. Only when we have overcome them will we understand why they were there.

Author: J.K. Rowling
Quote: You could say sorry," suggested Harry bluntly. "What, and get attacked by another flock of canaries?" muttered Ron."What did you have to imitate her for?""She laughed at my mustache!""So did I, it was the stupidest thing I've ever seen.

Author: Nicholas Sparks
Quote: Dreams are always crushing when they don't come true. But it's the simple dreams that are often the most painful because they seem so personal, so reasonable, so attainable. You're always close enough to touch, but never quite close enough to hold and it's enough to break your heart.

Author: Douglas Adams
Quote: Nothing travels faster than the speed of light, with the possible exception of bad news, which obeys its own special laws.

Author: Laurie Halse Anderson
Quote: In one aspect, yes, I believe in ghosts, but we create them. We haunt ourselves.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: Fashion is a form of ugliness so intolerable that we have to alter it every six months.

Author: Henry Thomas Buckle
Quote: Great minds discuss ideas. Average minds discuss events. Small minds discuss people.

Author: Marilyn Monroe
Quote: I don't mind making jokes, but I don't want to look like one.

Author: Markus Zusak
Quote: A small but noteworthy note. I've seen so many young men over the years who think they're running at other young men. They are not. They are running at me.

Author: David Henry Hwang
Quote: I'm happy. Which often looks like crazy.

Author: Lauren Oliver
Quote: I guess that's what saying good-bye is always like--like jumping off an edge. The worst part is making the choice to do it. Once you're in the air, there's nothing you can do but let go.

Author: George R.R. Martin
Quote: Most men would rather deny a hard truth than face it.

Author: Dan Brown
Quote: Men go to far greater lengths to avoid what they fear than to obtain what they desire.

Author: Helen Keller
Quote: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.

Author: Douglas Adams
Quote: He felt that his whole life was some kind of dream and he sometimes wondered whose it was and whether they were enjoying it.

Author: Lord Byron
Quote: There is a pleasure in the pathless woods,There is a rapture on the lonely shore,There is society, where none intrudes,By the deep sea, and music in its roar:I love not man the less, but Nature more

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: Well, she's not responding to my advances," he observed more brightly than he felt, "so she must be dead." "Or she's a woman of good taste and sense.

Author: Robert Frost
Quote: Freedom lies in being bold.

Author: William S. Burroughs
Quote: A paranoid is someone who knows a little of what's going on.

Author: Agatha Christie
Quote: The impossible could not have happened, therefore the impossible must be possible in spite of appearances.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: The surest way to corrupt a youth is to instruct him to hold in higher esteem those who think alike than those who think differently.

Author: Seamus Heaney
Quote: If you have the words, there's always a chance that you'll find the way.

Author: Neil Gaiman
Quote: Stories you read when you're the right age never quite leave you. You may forget who wrote them or what the story was called. Sometimes you'll forget precisely what happened, but if a story touches you it will stay with you, haunting the places in your mind that you rarely ever visit.

Author: Eleanor Roosevelt
Quote: Many people will walk in and out of your life, but only true friends will leave footprints in your heart

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: Have you tried talking to her?" "No. We've been punching her in the face repeatedly. What? You don't think that will work?

Author: Margaret Mitchell
Quote: With enough courage, you can do without a reputation.

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: Name the greatest of all inventors. Accident.

Author: Walt Whitman
Quote: Keep your face always toward the sunshine - and shadows will fall behind you.

Author: Anne Sexton
Quote: Watch out for intellect,because it knows so much it knows nothingand leaves you hanging upside down,mouthing knowledge as your heartfalls out of your mouth.

Author: Walt Disney
Quote: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: The advantage of a bad memory is that one enjoys several times the same good things for the first time.

Author: C.G. Jung
Quote: Your visions will become clear only when you can look into your own heart. Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.

Author: Stephen King
Quote: Alone. Yes, that's the key word, the most awful word in the English tongue. Murder doesn't hold a candle to it and hell is only a poor synonym.

Author: Charles M. Schulz
Quote: Nothing takes the taste out of peanut butter quite like unrequited love.

Author: Jack London
Quote: You can't wait for inspiration. You have to go after it with a club.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: When you trip over love, it is easy to get up. But when you fall in love, it is impossible to stand again.

Author: Markus Zusak
Quote: Usually we walk around constantly believing ourselves. "I'm okay" we say. "I'm alright". But sometimes the truth arrives on you and you can't get it off. That's when you realize that sometimes it isn't even an answer--it's a question. Even now, I wonder how much of my life is convinced.

Author: Rachel Carson
Quote: The more clearly we can focus our attention on the wonders and realities of the universe about us, the less taste we shall have for destruction.

Author: Nadezhda Mandelstam
Quote: I decided it is better to scream. Silence is the real crime against humanity.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: Whoever is careless with the truth in small matters cannot be trusted with important matters

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: Will rolled up his sleeves. "We'll probably have to knock down the door--" "Or," said Jem, reaching out and giving the knob a twist, "not." The door swung open onto a rectangle of darkness. "Now, that's simply laziness," said Will.

Author: Stephen Chbosky
Quote: I am both happy and sad at the same time, and I'm still trying to figure out how that could be.

Author: Margaret Atwood
Quote: Another belief of mine: that everyone else my age is an adult, whereas I am merely in disguise.

Author: Becca Fitzpatrick
Quote: Being with you never felt wrong. It's the one thing I did right. You're the one thing I did right.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: Is man merely a mistake of God's? Or God merely a mistake of man?

Author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
Quote: For me, I am driven by two main philosophies: know more today about the world than I knew yesterday and lessen the suffering of others. You'd be surprised how far that gets you.

Author: Charles bukowski
Quote: there is a place in the heart thatwill never be filleda spaceand even during thebest momentsandthe greatest timestimeswe will know itwe will know itmore thaneverthere is a place in the heart thatwill never be filledandwe will waitandwaitin that space.

Author: Stephenie Meyer
Quote: I decided as long as I'm going to hell, I might as well do it thoroughly.

Author: Roy T. Bennett
Quote: Do not set aside your happiness. Do not wait to be happy in the future. The best time to be happy is always now.

Author: Mae West
Quote: Good sex is like good bridge. If you don't have a good partner, you'd better have a good hand.

Author: Vincent Willem van Gogh
Quote: ...and then, I have nature and art and poetry, and if that is not enough, what is enough?

Author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning
Quote: How do I love thee? Let me count the ways.I love thee to the depth and breadth and heightMy soul can reach

Author: Markus Zusak
Quote: He was the crazy one who had painted himself black and defeated the world.She was the book thief without the words.Trust me, though, the words were on their way, and when they arrived, Liesel would hold them in her hands like the clouds, and she would wring them out like rain.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: Whenever people agree with me I always feel I must be wrong.

Author: Sarah J. Maas
Quote: I was not a pet, not a doll, not an animal.I was a survivor, and I was strong.I would not be weak, or helpless again I would not, could not be broken. Tamed.

Author: Nicholas Sparks
Quote: Without you in my arms, I feel an emptiness in my soul. I find myself searching the crowds for your face - I know it's an impossibility, but I cannot help myself.

Author: Daphne du Maurier
Quote: Women want love to be a novel. Men, a short story.

Author: Abraham Lincoln
Quote: When I do good, I feel good. When I do bad, I feel bad. That's my religion.

Author: Zig Ziglar
Quote: Of course motivation is not permanent. But then, neither is bathing; but it is something you should do on a regular basis.

Author: Will Rogers
Quote: Never miss a good chance to shut up.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: Never marry at all, Dorian. Men marry because they are tired, women, because they are curious: both are disappointed.

Author: Lemony Snicket
Quote: Well-read people are less likely to be evil.

Author: Taylor Swift
Quote: I suffer from girlnextdooritis where the guy is friends with you and that's it.

Author: C. S. Lewis
Quote: What draws people to be friends is that they see the same truth. They share it.

Author: Betty Smith
Quote: Look at everything always as though you were seeing it either for the first or last time: Thus is your time on earth filled with glory.

Author: Alan Moore
Quote: Behind this mask there is more than just flesh. Beneath this mask there is an idea... and ideas are bulletproof.

Author: William Shakespeare
Quote: The course of true love never did run smooth.

Author: Carl Sagan
Quote: Science is not only compatible with spirituality; it is a profound source of spirituality.

Author: Sarah J. Maas
Quote: How long was I asleep?" she whispered. He didn't respond. "How long was I asleep?" she asked again, and noticed a hint of red in his cheeks. "You were asleep, too?" "Until you began drooling on my shoulder.

Author: Veronica Roth
Quote: Sometimes, the best way to help someone is just to be near them.

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: You believe in a book that has talking animals, wizards, witches, demons, sticks turning into snakes, burning bushes, food falling from the sky, people walking on water, and all sorts of magical, absurd and primitive stories, and you say that we are the ones that need help?

Author: Richelle Mead
Quote: What's up?" I asked.You tell me," he said. "You were the one about ready to start making out with Adrian."It was an experiment," I said. "It was part of my therapy."What the hell kind of therapy are you in?

Author: Taylor Swift
Quote: This is a new year. A new beginning. And things will change.

Author: Suzanne Collins
Quote: District 12: Where you can starve to death in safety.

Author: Jonathan Safran Foer
Quote: Why do beautiful songs make you sad?' 'Because they aren't true.' 'Never?' 'Nothing is beautiful and true.

Author: Paulo Coelho
Quote: Now that she had nothing to lose, she was free.

Author: Anais Nin
Quote: Luxury is not a necessity to me, but beautiful and good things are.

Author: Alyson Noel
Quote: I guess by now I should know enough about loss to realize that you never really stop missing someone-you just learn to live around the huge gaping hole of their absence.

Author: Doris Lessing
Quote: What's terrible is to pretend that second-rate is first-rate. To pretend that you don't need love when you do; or you like your work when you know quite well you're capable of better.

Author: Ernest Hemingway
Quote: All thinking men are atheists.

Author: Napoleon Bonaparte
Quote: Courage isn't having the strength to go on - it is going on when you don't have strength.

Author: Isaac Asimov
Quote: Anti-intellectualism has been a constant thread winding its way through our political and cultural life, nurtured by the false notion that democracy means that 'my ignorance is just as good as your knowledge.'

Author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
Quote: The sunlight claps the earth, and the moonbeams kiss the sea: what are all these kissings worth, if thou kiss not me?

Author: Mother Teresa
Quote: The most terrible poverty is loneliness, and the feeling of being unloved.

Author: Umberto Eco
Quote: To survive, you must tell stories.

Author: Chuck Palahniuk
Quote: A girl calls and asks, "Does it hurt very much to die?""Well, sweetheart," I tell her, "yes, but it hurts a lot more to keep living.

Author: Confucius
Quote: He who knows all the answers has not been asked all the questions.

Author: Mother Teresa
Quote: Let no one ever come to you without leaving better and happier. Be the living expression of God's kindness: kindness in your face, kindness in your eyes, kindness in your smile.

Author: Voltaire
Quote: The more I read, the more I acquire, the more certain I am that I know nothing.

Author: Neil Gaiman
Quote: You get what anybody gets - you get a lifetime.

Author: Cheris Kramarae
Quote: Feminism is the radical notion that women are human beings.

Author: Alexandre Dumas
Quote: All human wisdom is contained in these two words - Wait and Hope

Author: Julie Kagawa
Quote: Oh, we're playing nice now? Shall we have tea first? Brew up a nice pot of kiss-my-ass?

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: No good deed goes unpunished.

Author: Maya Angelou
Quote: The desire to reach for the stars is ambitious. The desire to reach hearts is wise.

Author: George R.R. Martin
Quote: The things we love destroy us every time, lad. Remember that.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: Man is the cruelest animal.

Author: Judy Garland
Quote: Always be a first rate version of yourself and not a second rate version of someone else.

Author: John Green
Quote: Sometimes you lose a battle. But mischief always wins the war

Author: Rick Riordan
Quote: God alert!" Blackjack yelled. "It's the wine dude!Mr. D sighed in exasperation. "The next person, or horse, who calls me the 'wine dude' will end up in a bottle of Merlot!

Author: Groucho Marx
Quote: Humor is reason gone mad.

Author: Victor Hugo
Quote: It is nothing to die. It is frightful not to live.

Author: Cormac McCarthy
Quote: Scars have the strange power to remind us that our past is real.

Author: Bram Stoker
Quote: We learn from failure, not from success!

Author: Khaled Hosseini
Quote: Marriage can wait, education cannot.

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
Quote: The greatness of a nation and its moral progress can be judged by the way its animals are treated.

Author: Suzanne Collins
Quote: There are much worse games to play.

Author: Groucho Marx
Quote: I never forget a face, but in your case I'll be glad to make an exception.

Author: David Nicholls
Quote: This is where it all begins. Everything starts here, today.

Author: Stephen R. Covey
Quote: But until a person can say deeply and honestly, "I am what I am today because of the choices I made yesterday," that person cannot say, "I choose otherwise.

Author: Herman Melville
Quote: I know not all that may be coming, but be it what it will, I'll go to it laughing.

Author: John Keats
Quote: Do you not see how necessary a world of pains and troubles is to school an intelligence and make it a soul?

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
Quote: To give pleasure to a single heart by a single act is better than a thousand heads bowing in prayer.

Author: Albert Dietrich
Quote: There are perhaps many causes worth dying for, but to me, certainly, there are none worth killing for.

Author: J.K. Rowling
Quote: Don't let the muggles get you down.

Author: Aristotle
Quote: No great mind has ever existed without a touch of madness.

Author: John Muir
Quote: The mountains are calling and I must go.

Author: Dalai Lama XIV
Quote: My religion is very simple. My religion is kindness.

Author: Terry Pratchett
Quote: Five exclamation marks, the sure sign of an insane mind.

Author: Jonathan Safran Foer
Quote: She was a genius of sadness, immersing herself in it, separating its numerous strands, appreciating its subtle nuances. She was a prism through which sadness could be divided into its infinite spectrum.

Author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning
Quote: You're something between a dream and a miracle.

Author: George Orwell
Quote: But if thought corrupts language, language can also corrupt thought.

Author: Mary Oliver
Quote: Instructions for living a life. Pay attention. Be astonished. Tell about it.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: After a good dinner one can forgive anybody, even one's own relations.

Author: Anais Nin
Quote: The role of a writer is not to say what we can all say, but what we are unable to say.

Author: Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi
Quote: Lovers don't finally meet somewhere. They're in each other all along.

Author: Leigh Bardugo
Quote: Fear is a phoenix. You can watch it burn a thousand times and still it will return.

Author: John Steinbeck
Quote: It's so much darker when a light goes out than it would have been if it had never shone.

Author: Ellen DeGeneres
Quote: My grandmother started walking five miles a day when she was sixty. She's ninety-seven now, and we don't know where the heck she is.

Author: Walt Disney
Quote: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.

Author: George R.R. Martin
Quote: Death is so terribly final, while life is full of possibilities.

Author: Ayn Rand
Quote: Freedom (n.): To ask nothing. To expect nothing. To depend on nothing.

Author: H.L. Mencken
Quote: I know some who are constantly drunk on books as other men are drunk on whiskey.

Author: G.K. Chesterton
Quote: Literature is a luxury; fiction is a necessity.

Author: Lemony Snicket
Quote: If you are a student you should always get a good nights sleep unless you have come to the good part of your book, and then you should stay up all night and let your schoolwork fall by the wayside, a phrase which means 'flunk'.

Author: William Shakespeare
Quote: Stars, hide your fires; Let not light see my black and deep desires.

Author: Marilyn Monroe
Quote: We are all born sexual creatures,thank God, but it's a pity so many people despise and crush this natural gift.

Author: Dalai Lama XIV
Quote: There is a saying in Tibetan, 'Tragedy should be utilized as a source of strength.'No matter what sort of difficulties, how painful experience is, if we lose our hope, that's our real disaster.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: It is easy in the world to live after the world's opinion; it is easy in solitude to live after our own; but the great man is he who in the midst of the crowd keeps with perfect sweetness the independence of solitude.

Author: Mark A. Cooper
Quote: Life has no remote....get up and change it yourself!

Author: Ludwig van Beethoven
Quote: Music is ... A higher revelation than all Wisdom & Philosophy

Author: John Green
Quote: When things break, it's not the actual breaking that prevents them from getting back together again. It's because a little piece gets lost - the two remaining ends couldn't fit together even if they wanted to. The whole shape has changed.

Author: Elizabeth Gilbert
Quote: To lose balance sometimes for love is part of living a balancedlife.

Author: Rachel Caine
Quote: Damn, Claire. Warn a guy before you do a face-plant on the floor next time. I could have looked all heroic and caught you or something -Shane

Author: Gertrude Stein
Quote: We are always the same age inside.

Author: Maya Angelou
Quote: Ask for what you want and be prepared to get it!

Author: Dean Koontz
Quote: Never leave a friend behind. Friends are all we have to get us through this life--and they are the only things from this world that we could hope to see in the next.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: It is not the length of life, but the depth.

Author: Mae West
Quote: When I'm good, I'm very good, but when I'm bad, I'm better.

Author: Pablo Picasso
Quote: Others have seen what is and asked why. I have seen what could be and asked why not.

Author: Sarah Dessen
Quote: Holding people away from you, and denying yourself love, that doesn't make you strong. if anything, it makes you weaker. Because you're doing it out of fear.

Author: Hunter S. Thompson
Quote: So we shall let the reader answer this question for himself: who is the happier man, he who has braved the storm of life and lived or he who has stayed securely on shore and merely existed?

Author: Arthur Conan Doyle
Quote: There is nothing more deceptive than an obvious fact.

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: The easy confidence with which I know another man's religion is folly teaches me to suspect that my own is also.

Author: Isaac Asimov
Quote: Your assumptions are your windows on the world. Scrub them off every once in a while, or the light won't come in.

Author: Veronica Roth
Quote: Can you be a girl for a few seconds?""I'm always a girl" I frown."You know what I mean. Like a silly, annoying girl"I twirl my hair around my finger. "Kay.

Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca
Quote: Sometimes even to live is an act of courage.

Author: Gilles Deleuze
Quote: A concept is a brick. It can be used to build a courthouse of reason. Or it can be thrown through the window.

Author: Sherrilyn Kenyon
Quote: I don't suffer from my insanity -- I enjoy every minute of it.

Author: George Orwell
Quote: It was a bright cold day in April, and the clocks were striking thirteen.

Author: Roy T. Bennett
Quote: Help others without any reason and give without the expectation of receiving anything in return.

Author: G.K. Chesterton
Quote: Fairy tales do not tell children the dragons exist. Children already know that dragons exist. Fairy tales tell children the dragons can be killed.

Author: Charles Baudelaire
Quote: One should always be drunk. That's all that matters...But with what? With wine, with poetry, or with virtue, as you chose. But get drunk.

Author: George Washington
Quote: It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one.

Author: Anais Nin
Quote: Throw your dreams into space like a kite, and you do not know what it will bring back, a new life, a new friend, a new love, a new country.

Author: Woody Allen
Quote: Life doesn't imitate art, it imitates bad television.

Author: Albert Camus
Quote: Real generosity towards the future lies in giving all to the present.

Author: Ken Kesey
Quote: Man, when you lose your laugh you lose your footing.

Author: Ben Okri
Quote: The most authentic thing about us is our capacity to create, to overcome, to endure, to transform, to love and to be greater than our suffering.

Author: Andre Aciman
Quote: We rip out so much of ourselves to be cured of things faster than we should that we go bankrupt by the age of thirty and have less to offer each time we start with someone new. But to feel nothing so as not to feel anything - what a waste!

Author: Marilyn Monroe
Quote: I just want to be wonderful.

Author: William Shakespeare
Quote: Lord, what fools these mortals be!

Author: Jack Kerouac
Quote: What is that feeling when you're driving away from people and they recede on the plain till you see their specks dispersing? - it's the too-huge world vaulting us, and it's good-bye. But we lean forward to the next crazy venture beneath the skies.

Author: Brian Selznick
Quote: I address you all tonight for who you truly are: wizards, mermaids, travelers, adventurers, and magicians. You are the true dreamers.

Author: Becca Fitzpatrick
Quote: Hang on, did you just call me Angel?" I asked."If I did?""I don't like it."He grinned. "It stays, Angel.

Author: J.D. Salinger
Quote: That's the thing about girls. Every time they do something pretty, even if they're not much to look at, or even if they're sort of stupid, you fall in love with them, and then you never know where the hell you are. Girls. Jesus Christ. They can drive you crazy. They really can.

Author: J.K. Rowling
Quote: You think the dead we loved ever truly leave us? You think that we don't recall them more clearly in times of great trouble?

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: I don't care," Clary said. "He'd do it for me. Tell me he wouldn't. If I were missing-" "He'd burn the whole world down till he could dig you out of the ashes. I know," Alec said.

Author: Roy T. Bennett
Quote: Believe in your infinite potential. Your only limitations are those you set upon yourself.

Author: Hayley Williams
Quote: Sometimes it takes a good fall to really know where you stand

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.

Author: Tolstoy Leo
Quote: If you want to be happy, be.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: The unhappiest people in this world, are those who care the most about what other people think.

Author: Pablo Neruda
Quote: I love you as certain dark things are loved, secretly, between the shadow and the soul.

Author: Haruki Murakami
Quote: Unfortunately, the clock is ticking, the hours are going by. The past increases, the future recedes. Possibilities decreasing, regrets mounting.

Author: Jennifer Niven
Quote: The thing I realize is, that it's not what you take, it's what you leave.

Author: Robert Frost
Quote: Poetry is what gets lost in translation.

Author: Suzanne Collins
Quote: It crosses my mind that Cinna's calm and normal demeanor masks a complete madman.

Author: Plato
Quote: Do not train a child to learn by force or harshness; but direct them to it by what amuses their minds, so that you may be better able to discover with accuracy the peculiar bent of the genius of each.

Author: Virginia Woolf
Quote: When you consider things like the stars, our affairs don't seem to matter very much, do they?

Author: Steve Maraboli
Quote: Happiness is not the absence of problems, it's the ability to deal with them.

Author: Madeline Miller
Quote: When he died, all things soft and beautiful and bright would be buried with him.

Author: Madeline Miller
Quote: He is half of my soul, as the poets say.

Author: Patrick Rothfuss
Quote: When we are children we seldom think of the future. This innocence leaves us free to enjoy ourselves as few adults can. The day we fret about the future is the day we leave our childhood behind.

Author: Leo Tolstoy
Quote: Spring is the time of plans and projects.

Author: Sarah J. Maas
Quote: And then I am going to rattle the stars.

Author: Chaim Potok
Quote: I've begun to realize that you can listen to silence and learn from it. It has a quality and a dimension all its own.

Author: Christopher Moore
Quote: People, generally, suck.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: Peace cannot be kept by force; it can only be achieved by understanding.

Author: Bill Watterson
Quote: People think it must be fun to be a super genius, but they don't realize how hard it is to put up with all the idiots in the world.

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: We need to talk. All of us About what we're going to do now.""I was going to watch Project Runway.

Author: Adolf Hitler
Quote: If you win, you need not have to explain...If you lose, you should not be there to explain!

Author: William Shakespeare
Quote: My only love sprung from my only hate!Too early seen unknown, and known too late!Prodigious birth of love it is to me,That I must love a loathed enemy.

Author: Paulo Coelho
Quote: This is what we call love. When you are loved, you can do anything in creation. When you are loved, there's no need at all to understand what's happening, because everything happens within you.

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: Black hair and blue eyes are my favorite combination.

Author: Barbara Kingsolver
Quote: There is no point treating a depressed person as though she were just feeling sad, saying, 'There now, hang on, you'll get over it.' Sadness is more or less like a head cold- with patience, it passes. Depression is like cancer.

Author: Elizabeth Gilbert
Quote: Your emotions are the slaves to your thoughts, and you are the slave to your emotions.

Author: Gena Showalter
Quote: I don't hate you.. I just don't like that you exist

Author: Mary Ann Shaffer
Quote: I don't want to be married just to be married. I can't think of anything lonelier than spending the rest of my life with someone I can't talk to, or worse, someone I can't be silent with.

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: I figured all your classes were stuff like Slaughter 101 and Beheading for Beginners."Jace flipped a page. "Very funny, Fray.

Author: Charles Bukowski
Quote: Poetry is what happens when nothing else can.

Author: Joseph Conrad
Quote: We live as we dream--alone....

Author: Charles Dickens
Quote: No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another.

Author: Veronica Roth
Quote: Moths," repeats Will. "You're afraid of moths?" "Not just a cloud of moths," she says, "like...a swarm of them. Everywhere. All those wings and legs and..." She shudders and shakes her head."Terrifying," Will says with mock seriousness. "That's my girl. Tough as cotton balls.""Oh, Shut up.

Author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
Quote: The soul is healed by being with children.

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: Clary felt suddenly annoyed. "When the self-congratulatory part of the evening is over, maybe we could get back to saving my best friend from being exsanguinated to death?""Exsanguinated," said Jace, impressed. "That's a big word.""And you're a big-""Tsk tsk," he interupted. "No swearing in church.

Author: Lewis Caroll
Quote: If everybody minded their own business, the world would go around a great deal faster than it does.

Author: Kurt Vonnegut
Quote: Tiger got to hunt, bird got to fly;Man got to sit and wonder 'why, why, why?'Tiger got to sleep, bird got to land;Man got to tell himself he understand.

Author: Tim O'Brien
Quote: That's what fiction is for. It's for getting at the truth when the truth isn't sufficient for the truth.

Author: Mother Teresa
Quote: If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other.

Author: Nicholas Sparks
Quote: In times of grief and sorrow I will hold you and rock you and take your grief and make it my own. When you cry I cry and when you hurt I hurt. And together we will try to hold back the floods to tears and despair and make it through the potholed street of life

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
Quote: Each night, when I go to sleep, I die. And the next morning, when I wake up, I am reborn.

Author: Jodi Picoult
Quote: You know it's never fifty-fifty in a marriage. It's always seventy-thirty, or sixty-forty. Someone falls in love first. Someone puts someone else up on a pedestal. Someone works very hard to keep things rolling smoothly; someone else sails along for the ride.

Author: Suzanne Collins
Quote: The bird, the pin, the song, the berries, the watch, the cracker, the dress that burst into flames. I am the mockingjay. The one that survived despite the Capitol's plans. The symbol of the rebellion.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: Dare to live the life you have dreamed for yourself. Go forward and make your dreams come true.

Author: Kiera Cass
Quote: I hope you find someone you can't live without.I really do. And I hope you never have to know what it's like to have to try and live without them.

Author: Steven Moffat
Quote: Demons run when a good man goes to warNight will fall and drown the sunWhen a good man goes to warFriendship dies and true love liesNight will fall and the dark will riseWhen a good man goes to warDemons run, but count the costThe battle's won, but the child is lost

Author: George Carlin
Quote: If you try to fail, and succeed, which have you done?

Author: Bram Stoker
Quote: Listen to them, the children of the night. What music they make!

Author: J.K. Rowling
Quote: Hello, Harry" said George, beaming at him. "We thought we heard your dulcet tones.""You don't want to bottle up your anger like that, Harry, let it all out," said Fred, also beaming. "There might be a couple of people fifty miles away who didn't hear you.

Author: George Washington Burnap
Quote: The grand essentials to happiness in this life are something to do, something to love, and something to hope for.

Author: Samuel Beckett
Quote: We are all born mad. Some remain so.

Author: Isaac Asimov
Quote: If my doctor told me I had only six minutes to live, I wouldn't brood. I'd type a little faster.

Author: Robert Frost
Quote: Half the world is composed of people who have something to say and can't, and the other half who have nothing to say and keep on saying it.

Author: J.K. Rowling
Quote: But Dumbledore says he doesn't care what they do as long as they don't take him off the Chocolate Frog cards.

Author: Lauren Oliver
Quote: It's so strange how life works: You want something and you wait and wait and feel like it's taking forever to come. Then it happens and it's over and all you want to do is curl back up in that moment before things changed.

Author: Robin  Williams
Quote: See, the problem is that God gives men a brain and a penis, and only enough blood to run one at a time.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: A question that sometimes drives me hazy: am I or are the others crazy?

Author: Joseph Joubert
Quote: The worst thing about new books is that they keep us from reading the old ones.

Author: Paulo Coelho
Quote: None of us knows what might happen even the next minute, yet still we go forward. Because we trust. Because we have faith.

Author: Henry David Thoreau
Quote: Dreams are the touchstones of our characters.

Author: John Banville
Quote: The past beats inside me like a second heart.

Author: Shel Silverstein
Quote: The VoiceThere is a voice inside of youThat whispers all day long,"I feel this is right for me,I know that this is wrong."No teacher, preacher, parent, friendOr wise man can decideWhat's right for you--just listen toThe voice that speaks inside.

Author: Richard Evans
Quote: It is often in the darkest skies that we see the brightest stars.

Author: Johnny Depp
Quote: if you love two people at the same time, choose the second. Because if you really loved the first one, you wouldn't have fallen for the second.

Author: Eleanor Roosevelt
Quote: No matter how plain a woman may be, if truth and honesty are written across her face, she will be beautiful.

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: In the end that was the choice you made, and it doesn't matter how hard it was to make it. It matters that you did.

Author: Woody Allen
Quote: The difference between sex and love is that sex relieves tension and love causes it.

Author: Gustave Flaubert
Quote: Be steady and well-ordered in your life so that you can be fierce and original in your work.

Author: John Anster
Quote: Whatever you can do or dream you can, begin it.Boldness has genius, power and magic in it!

Author: Alfred Tennyson
Quote: I am a part of all that I have met.

Author: Chuck Palahniuk
Quote: Today is the sort of day where the sun only comes up to humiliate you.

Author: John Henry Newman
Quote: I sought to hear the voice of God and climbed the topmost steeple, but God declared: "Go down again - I dwell among the people.

Author: Maya Angelou
Quote: Stepping onto a brand-new path is difficult, but not more difficult than remaining in a situation, which is not nurturing to the whole woman.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: Morality is simply the attitude we adopt towards people we personally dislike.

Author: John Grisham
Quote: In life, finding a voice is speaking and living the truth. Each of you is an original. Each of you has a distinctive voice. When you find it, your story will be told. You will be heard.

Author: Edith Sitwell
Quote: Winter is the time for comfort, for good food and warmth, for the touch of a friendly hand and for a talk beside the fire: it is the time for home.

Author: Sarah Dessen
Quote: Silence is so freaking loud
